register.description: Product type ID register

bitfield.description: Product type : This field contains the ASCII codes that represent the product type sd for SerDes.

register.description: Product number ID register

bitfield.description: Product number : This field contains the binary coded decimal numbers that represent the product number.

register.description: Product revision ID register

bitfield.description: Product revision : This field contains the binary coded decimal numbers that represent the product revision.

register.description: Product technology manufacturer ID register

bitfield.description: Product technology process node : This field contains the binary coded decimal numbers that represent the product technology node
Product technology manufacturer : This field contains the ASCII codes that represent the product technology manufacturer t for TSMC.

register.description: Product technology process flavor ID register 0

bitfield.description: Product technology flavor : This field contains the ASCII codes that represent the second two characters of the product technology flavor.
Product technology flavor : This field contains the ASCII codes that represent the first two characters of the product technology flavor.

register.description: Product I/O voltage ID register

bitfield.description: Product SerDes lanes left of common : This field contains the binary coded decimal numbers that represent the number of lanes implemented in this SerDes product on the left side of the common module.

Product SerDes lanes right of common : This field contains the binary coded decimal numbers that represent the number of lanes implemented in this SerDes product on the right side of the common module.
Product I/O voltage : This field contains the binary coded decimal numbers that represent the product I/O voltage.

bitfield.description: Product xy metal layers : This field contains the binary coded decimal number that represent the number of xy metal layers used for this product.
Product xe metal layers : This field contains the binary coded decimal number that represent the number of xe metal layers used for this product.
Product xd metal layers : This field contains the binary coded decimal number that represent the number of xd metal layers used for this product.
Product xc metal layers : This field contains the binary coded decimal number that represent the number of xc metal layers used for this product.
Product xa metal layers : This field contains the binary coded decimal number that represent the number of xa metal layers used for this product.
Product x metal layers : This field contains the binary coded decimal number that represent the number of x metal layers used for this product.

bitfield.description: Product yz metal layers : This field contains the binary coded decimal number that represent the number of yz metal layers used for this product.
Product u metal layers : This field contains the binary coded decimal number that represent the number of u metal layers used for this product.
Product r metal layers : This field contains the binary coded decimal number that represent the number of r metal layers used for this product.
Product z metal layers : This field contains the binary coded decimal number that represent the number of z metal layers used for this product.
Product yz metal layers : This field contains the binary coded decimal number that represent the number of yz metal layers used for this product.
Product yy metal layers : This field contains the binary coded decimal number that represent the number of yy metal layers used for this product.
Product ya metal layers : This field contains the binary coded decimal number that represent the number of ya metal layers used for this product.
Product y metal layers : This field contains the binary coded decimal number that represent the number of y metal layers used for this product.

register.description: Product metal layer direction ID register

bitfield.description: Metal 11 direction (when used) :
Metal 10 direction (when used) :
Metal 9 direction (when used) :
Metal 8 direction :
Metal 7 direction :
Metal 6 direction :
Metal 5 direction :

register.description: Startup state machine control register

bitfield.description: Bandgap enable state timer value : Value used for the timer when the startup state machine is in the bandgap enable state.
Bandgap enable override enable : When active (1'b1), the bandgap enable override bit in this register will drive the ssmda_bandgap_en pin from the SSM directly.
Bandgap enable override : When enabled by the bandgap enable override enable bit in this register, this bit will drive the ssmda_bandgap_en pin from the SSM directly.
Bias enable override enable : When active (1'b1), the bias enable override bit in this register will drive the ssmda_bias_en pin from the SSM directly.
Bias enable override : When enabled by the bias enable override enable bit in this register, this bit will drive the ssmda_bias_en pin from the SSM directly.
Skip post bandgap enable re-calibration : When this bit is active (1'b1), the post bandgap enable calibration state will be skipped if it was previously run, unless the macro is disabled or reset.
Skip auto re-calibration : When this bit is active (1'b1), the auto calibration state will be skipped if it was previously run, unless the macro is disabled or reset.

register.description: Bias enable timer register

bitfield.description: Bias enable state timer value : Value used for the timer when the startup state machine is in the bias enable state.

register.description: Startup state machine user defined control register

bitfield.description: Reserved - spare
Force SSM gated clock on: Setting this bit to 1'b1 will force the SSM gated clock on, independent of the internal SSM state machine clock gate controls.
Bandgap enable hold enable: This bit enables the bandgap enable hold function, which holds the bandgap enable active in the common suspend state until the signal detect function is switched off.

register.description: PLL 0 control state machine control register

bitfield.description: PLL enable state timer value : Value used for the timer when the startup state machine is in the PLL enable state.
PLL enable override enable : When active (1'b1), the PLL enable override bit in this register will drive the pllsmda_pll_en pin from the PLLSM directly.
PLL enable override : When enabled by the PLL enable override enable bit in this register, this bit will drive the pllsmda_pll_en pin from the PLLSM directly.
PLL reset override enable : When active (1'b1), the PLL reset override bit in this register will drive the
PLL reset override : When enabled by the PLL reset override enable bit in this register, this bit will drive the pllsmda_pll_rst_n pin from the PLLSM directly.
PLL pre charge override enable : When active (1'b1), the PLL pre charge override bit in this register will drive the pllsmda_pll_pre_charge pin from the PLLSM directly.
PLL pre charge override : When enabled by the PLL pre charge override enable bit in this register, this bit will drive the pllsmda_pll_pre_charge pin from the PLLSM directly.
Skip PLL re-calibration : When this bit is active (1'b1), the PLL calibration state will be skipped if it was previously run, unless the PLL is disabled or resetting the state machine.

register.description: PLL 0 pre-charge timer register

bitfield.description: PLL VREF delay state timer value : Value used for the timer when the startup state machine is in the PLL VREF delay state.
PLL pre-charge state timer value : Value used for the timer when the startup state machine is in the PLL pre-charge state.

register.description: PLL 0 lock delay timer register

bitfield.description: PLL clock disable delay state timer value : Value used for the timer when the startup state machine is in the PLL clock disable delay state.
PLL lock delay state timer value : Value used for the timer when the startup state machine is in the PLL lock delay state.

register.description: PLL 0 control state machine user defined control register

bitfield.description: Reserved - spare
PLL lock override: When active (1'b1), this bit will force the PLL lock indication active.

register.description: PLL 1 control state machine control register

bitfield.description: PLL enable state timer value : Value used for the timer when the startup state machine is in the PLL enable state.
PLL enable override enable : When active (1'b1), the PLL enable override bit in this register will drive the pllsmda_pll_en pin from the PLLSM directly.
PLL enable override : When enabled by the PLL enable override enable bit in this register, this bit will drive the pllsmda_pll_en pin from the PLLSM directly.
PLL reset override enable : When active (1'b1), the PLL reset override bit in this register will drive the
PLL reset override : When enabled by the PLL reset override enable bit in this register, this bit will drive the pllsmda_pll_rst_n pin from the PLLSM directly.
PLL pre charge override enable : When active (1'b1), the PLL pre charge override bit in this register will drive the pllsmda_pll_pre_charge pin from the PLLSM directly.
PLL pre charge override : When enabled by the PLL pre charge override enable bit in this register, this bit will drive the pllsmda_pll_pre_charge pin from the PLLSM directly.
Skip PLL re-calibration : When this bit is active (1'b1), the PLL calibration state will be skipped if it was previously run, unless the PLL is disabled or resetting the state machine.

register.description: PLL 1 pre-charge timer register

bitfield.description: PLL VREF delay state timer value : Value used for the timer when the startup state machine is in the PLL VREF delay state.
PLL pre-charge state timer value : Value used for the timer when the startup state machine is in the PLL pre-charge state.

register.description: PLL 1 lock delay timer register

bitfield.description: PLL clock disable delay state timer value : Value used for the timer when the startup state machine is in the PLL clock disable delay state.
PLL lock delay state timer value : Value used for the timer when the startup state machine is in the PLL lock delay state.

register.description: PLL 1 control state machine user defined control register

bitfield.description: Reserved - spare
PLL lock override: When active (1'b1), this bit will force the PLL lock indication active.

register.description: Common power island control timer register

bitfield.description: Power island controller input override enable: When enabled, the power island control state machine input override bits in this register will drive the power island control state machine directly, and override any control from other state machines in the macro.

Power island controller output override enable: When enabled, the power island control state machine output override bits in this register will drive the power island control state machine outputs, and override any control from power island control state machine.
Power suspend request override: When enabled, this bit will override the power_suspend_req input of the power island control state machine.
Power suspend acknowledge: This is the current state of the power_suspend_ack output from the power island control state machine.
Power recover request override: When enabled, this bit will override the power_recover_req input of the power island control state machine.
Power recover acknowledge: This is the current state of the power_recover_ack output from the power island control state machine.
Power island controller output override: When enabled, the bits in this field will override the output signals from the power island control state machine.

Power enable phase 2 timer value: This specifies the number of reference clock cycles the power island control state machines in common will wait in the power phase 2 enable states, in order to allow enough time for the second phase of the switched domain to power up, before deactivating the isolation functions.

Power enable phase 1 timer value: This specifies the number of reference clock cycles the power island control state machines in common will wait in the power phase 1 enable states, in order to allow enough time for the first phase of the switched domain to power up, before enabling the second phase of the power up.

register.description: Common CDB power island control status register

bitfield.description: Power island controller input override enable: When enabled, the power island control state machine input override bits in this register will drive the power island control state machine directly, and override any control from other state machines in the macro.

Power island controller output override enable: When enabled, the power island control state machine output override bits in this register will drive the power island control state machine outputs, and override any control from power island control state machine.
Power suspend request override: When enabled, this bit will override the power_suspend_req input of the power island control state machine.
Power suspend acknowledge: This is the current state of the power_suspend_ack output from the power island control state machine.
Power recover request override: When enabled, this bit will override the power_recover_req input of the power island control state machine.
Power recover acknowledge: This is the current state of the power_recover_ack output from the power island control state machine.
Power island controller output override: When enabled, the bits in this field will override the output signals from the power island control state machine.
Power island controller output status: This field indicates the current state of the output signals from the power island control state machine.

Power island controller output override enable: When enabled, the power island control state machine output override bits in this register will drive the power island control state machine outputs, and override any control from power island control state machine.

register.description: Common diagnostic power island control status register

bitfield.description: Common PLL 1 full rate and data rate source clock select: Selects the PLL source clock to use when generating the cmn_pll1_clk_fullrt, cmn_pll1_clk_datart0, and cmn_pll1_clk_datart1 clocks.
Common PLL 0 full rate and data rate source clock select: Selects the PLL source clock to use when generating the cmn_pll0_clk_fullrt, cmn_pll0_clk_datart0, and cmn_pll0_clk_datart1 clocks.
Power island controller output status: This field indicates the current state of the output signals from the power island control state machine.

register.description: Reference clock receiver override register

bitfield.description: Reserved - spare
Reference clock driver 0 test mode enable: Enables the reference clock driver DC test mode, by controlling the cmnda_ref_clk0_drv_test_en signal going into the analog.

Reference clock driver 0 test mode value: When enabled by the reference clock driver 0 test mode enable bit in this register, the value in this bit will be driven by the reference clock driver, by controlling the cmnda_ref_clk0_drv_test_val signal going into the analog.
Reference clock receiver test mode enable: Enables the reference clock receiver DC test mode, by controlling the cmnda_ref_clk_rcv_test_en signal going into the analog.

Reference clock receiver test mode PLL value: When enabled by the reference clock receiver test mode enable bit in this register, the value in this bit will be the value present on the PLL reference clock receiver.

Reference clock receiver test mode digital value: When enabled by the reference clock receiver test mode enable bit in this register, the value in this bit will be the value present on the digital reference clock receiver.
Derived reference clock source select: Selects which PLL is the source for the derived reference clock, by driving the cmnda_ref_clk_der_src_sel signal to the analog.
Digital reference clock receiver hysteresis adjust: Control the amount of hysteresis used for the digital reference clock receiver, by driving the cmnda_ref_clk_dig_hyst_adj signal to the analog.
Analog reference clock enable override: This bit can be used to force the cmnda_ref_clk_en signal going to the analog to the active state.
Reference clock AC coupling cap bypass: Controls the bypassing of the AC coupling caps in the differential receiver.
Derived reference clock enable: Enables the derived reference clock function, by driving the cmnda_ref_clk_der_en signal to the analog.
Reference clock high pass filter control: Controls the cutoff frequency of the high pass filter in the reference clock receiver input.
Reference clock receiver circuit clock control:

register.description: Power state machine clock receiver control register

bitfield.description: Oscillator Enable Override Enable: This bit enables the oscillator enable override bit in this register to directly control the signal detect oscillator.
Oscillator Enable Override: When enabled by the oscillator enable override enable bit in this register, this bit can be used to directly control the enable of the signal detect oscillator.
PSM clock divider value: The value of this field is used to control the divider setting of the PSM clock divider.

register.description: Reference clock bump driver 0 control register

bitfield.description: Clock driver drive current tune: Controls the amplitude of the reference clock driver, by controlling the cmnda_ref_clk0_itune signal going to the analog.

Reference clock driver high Z: When the reference clock driver is disabled, this controls if the driver outputs are high Z or pulled low, by controlling the cmnda_ref_clk0_drv_highz signal going to the analog.
Clock driver termination: Enables the termination in the reference clock driver, by controlling the cmnda_ref_clk0_termination signal going to the analog.
Clock select: Selects which reference clock that will be driven by the reference clock driver, by controlling the cmnda_ref_clk0_clk_select signal going to the analog.
Clock gate enable override enable: This bit enables the clock gate enable override bit in this register to override the clock gate of the reference clock driver.

Clock gate enable override: When enabled by the clock gate enable override enable bit in this register, this bit can be used to directly control the clock gate enable of the reference clock driver by controlling the cmnda_ref_clk0_clk_gate_en signal going to the analog.
Driver enable override enable: This bit enables the driver enable override bit in this register to override the enable of the reference clock driver.

Driver enable override: When enabled by the driver enable override enable bit in this register, this bit can be used to directly control the enable of the reference clock driver by controlling the cmnda_ref_clk0_drv_en signal going to the analog.

register.description: Common control CDB diagnostic register

bitfield.description: Current state of the cdb_isl_ctrl_sm_reset_n reset.
Current state of the cmn_reset_sync_n reset.
CDB bus error: This bit will be set when the internal CDB watchdog timer expires.

register.description: Common control cover your alternatives register

bitfield.description: Reserved - spare

register.description: Bandgap calibration control register

bitfield.description: Bandgap code override enable: Activation (1'b1) of this register bit allows the bandgap codes determined during the automatic calibration process to be overridden.
Analog calibration enable override: Activation (1'b1) of this register bit will force the analog calibration circuits to be enabled by activating the cmnda_bias_bgcal_en enable.
Bandgap code override value: These bits are used to override the bandgap code determined during the automatic calibration process.
Start bandgap calibration: Activating (1'b1) this bit will start the bandgap calibration process.
Bandgap calibration process done: This bit will be set to 1'b1 when the bandgap calibration process is complete.

No analog calibration response : This signal indicates that the calibration function has gone through the entire calibration process, reached the final calibration value, and the analog has not responded indicating that a valid calibration value has been reached.
Current analog comparator response: This is the current state of the analog comparator response signal (cmnda_bias_bgcal_comp).
Bandgap calibration code: This is the calibration code that was determined by the bandgap calibration process.

register.description: Bandgap calibration start register

bitfield.description: Bandgap calibration tune value: The value of this field is added to the automatically calibrated code, or the override code if override is enabled.
Bandgap calibration direction: This controls the direction that the automatic calibration process steps the calibration codes in.
Start bandgap calibration code: This is the calibration code that the calibration process starts with when automatic calibration is run.

register.description: Bandgap calibration initialization timer register

bitfield.description: Iteration wait timer value: This is the number of cmn_ref_clk clocks to wait between when a value is placed on the bandgap calibration signals going to the analog, and when the comparator value coming from the analog circuits can be checked.

Initialization wait timer value: This is the number of cmn_ref_clk clocks to wait between when the analog bandgap calibration circuits are enabled, and when the first values are placed on the bandgap calibration signals going to the analog.

register.description: External bias current calibration control register

bitfield.description: Calibration code override enable: Activation (1'b1) of this register bit allows the calibration code determined during the automatic resistor calibration process to be overridden.

Analog calibration enable override: Activation (1'b1) of this register bit will force the analog calibration circuits to be enabled by activating the cmnda_ibiascal_en enable and the cmnda_ibiascal_clk clock.
Calibration code override value: These bits are used to override the calibration code determined during the automatic resistor calibration process.
Start calibration: Activating (1'b1) this bit will start the calibration process.
Calibration process done: This bit will be set to 1'b1 when the calibration process is complete.

No analog calibration response : This signal indicates that the calibration function has gone through the entire calibration process, reached the final calibration value, and the analog has not responded indicating that a valid calibration value has been reached.
Current analog comparator response: This is the current state of the analog comparator response signal (cmnda_ibiascal_comp).
Calibration code: This is the calibration code that was determined by the calibration process.

register.description: External bias current calibration start register

bitfield.description: Calibration tune value: The value of this field is added to the automatically calibrated code, or the override code if override is enabled.
Calibration direction: This controls the direction that the automatic calibration process steps the calibration codes in.
Start resistor calibration code: This is the calibration code that the resistor calibration process starts with when automatic calibration is run.

register.description: External bias current calibration initialization timer register

bitfield.description: Iteration wait timer value: This is the number of cmn_ref_clk clocks to wait between when a value is placed on the calibration selection bus going to the analog, and when the comparator value coming from the analog circuits can be checked.

Initialization wait timer value: This is the number of cmn_ref_clk clocks to wait between when the analog calibration circuits are enabled, and when the first calibration selection value is placed on the calibration code bus, going to the analog.

register.description: PLL 0 VCO calibration control register

bitfield.description: VCO calibration initial step size control: This field specifies the initial step size for the VCO calibration state machine.
VCO calibration code starting point value: This field specifies the starting VCO code that is used by the VCO calibration state machine.
Start VCO calibration: Activating (1'b1) this bit will start a VCO calibration process.
VCO calibration process done: This bit will be set to 1'b1 when the VCO calibration process is complete.
VCO calibration code: This is the calibration code that was determined by the VCO calibration process.

register.description: PLL 0 VCO calibration timer control register

bitfield.description: VCO calibration code override enable: Activating (1'b1) this bit allows the VCO code determined during the automatic VCO calibration process to be overridden by the value driven by the VCO calibration code override value field in this register.
VCO calibration code override value: This field is used to override the VCO code determined during the automatic VCO calibration process.

VCO calibration initial time scale control: This field specifies the calibration start time scaling factor applied to the VCO calibration when running the initial step size for the calibration code if not set to 1.

register.description: PLL 0 VCO calibration initialization timer register

bitfield.description: Iteration wait timer value: This is the number of clocks to wait between when a calibration code is driven to the analog, and when the clock rates are measured.
Initialization wait timer value: This is the number of clocks to wait between when the analog VCO calibration circuits are enabled, and when the first calibration code is driven to the analog.

register.description: PLL 0 VCO calibration reference clock timer start value register

bitfield.description: PLL VCO calibration reference clock timer start value : This is the value that is loaded into the reference clock timer as the starting point for that timer, when running VCO calibration.

register.description: PLL 0 VCO calibration PLL clock counter start value register

bitfield.description: PLL VCO calibration PLL clock counter start value : This is the value that is loaded into the PLL clock counter as the starting point for that counter, when running VCO calibration.

register.description: PLL 0 feedback divider integer register mode 0

bitfield.description: pll_fb_div_fractional: Value of the pll_fb_div_fractional[15:0] signal.
pll_fb_div_integer value: Value of the pll_fb_div_integer signal.

register.description: PLL 0 feedback divider fractional high register mode 0

bitfield.description: pll_fb_div_high_theshold: Value of the pll_fb_div_high_threshold signal.
pll_fb_div_fractional: Value of the pll_fb_div_fractional[18:16] signal.

register.description: PLL 0 delta sigma modulator diagnostics register mode 0

bitfield.description: PLL feedback divider high override value : When enabled by the PLL feedback divider override enable bit in the PLL 0 delta sigma modulator diagnostics register mode 0 on page 102, the value in this field will be used to override the value on the cmnda_pll0_fb_div_high signal.
Delta sigma bypass enable: When set to 1'b1, the delta sigma modulator will be bypassed, and the output will be the value specified for the internal pll_fb_div_integer signal.

PLL feedback divider override enable : When active (1'b1), the feedback divider low and high override values in the PLL 0 delta sigma modulator feedback divider value high override register mode 0 on page 102 and PLL 0 delta sigma modulator feedback divider value low override register mode 0 on page 102 registers will be used to override the feedback divider values driven to the analog.

PLL feedback divider latency adjustment: This signal specifies a value to be subtracted from the feedback divider settings before they are output on the cmnda_pll0_fb_div_high and cmnda_pll0_fb_div_low signals.

register.description: PLL 0 delta sigma modulator feedback divider value low override register mode 0

bitfield.description: PLL feedback divider low override value : When enabled by the PLL feedback divider override enable bit in the PLL 0 delta sigma modulator diagnostics register mode 0 on page 102, the value in this field will be used to override the value on the cmnda_pll0_fb_div_low signal.

register.description: PLL 0 spread spectrum control register 1 mode 0

bitfield.description: Amplitude step size: Value of the amplitude_step_size pin on the spread spectrum waveform generator.
Spread spectrum waveform generator disable: Setting this bit to a 1'b1 will disable the spread spectrum waveform generator.
Spread spectrum enable during VCO calibration : Setting this bit to a 1'b1 will enable the spread spectrum function while VCO calibration is taking place.

register.description: PLL 0 spread spectrum control register 3 mode 0

bitfield.description: Time step size: Value for the time_step_size pin on the spread spectrum waveform generator.
Number of steps: Value of the num_steps pin on the spread spectrum waveform generator.

register.description: PLL 0 lock reference counter start value register

bitfield.description: PLL lock reference counter idle value : This is the value used by the PLL lock detection logic to specify the number of reference clocks between each phase of counting PLL clocks.
PLL lock reference counter start value : This is the value that is loaded into the PLL lock detect reference counter as the starting point for that counter, when checking for PLL lock.

register.description: PLL 0 lock PLL counter start value register

bitfield.description: PLL lock counter threshold value : This is the value used by the PLL lock detection logic to determine if the PLL has locked.
PLL lock PLL counter start value : This is the value that is loaded into the PLL lock detect PLL counter as the starting point for that counter, when checking for PLL lock.

register.description: PLL 0 feedback divider integer register mode 1

bitfield.description: pll_fb_div_fractional: Value of the pll_fb_div_fractional[15:0] signal.
pll_fb_div_integer value: Value of the pll_fb_div_integer signal.

register.description: PLL 0 feedback divider fractional high register mode 1

bitfield.description: pll_fb_div_high_theshold: Value of the pll_fb_div_high_threshold signal.
pll_fb_div_fractional: Value of the pll_fb_div_fractional[18:16] signal.

register.description: PLL 0 delta sigma modulator diagnostics register mode 1

bitfield.description: PLL feedback divider high override value : When enabled by the PLL feedback divider override enable bit in the PLL 0 delta sigma modulator diagnostics register mode 0 on page 102, the value in this field will be used to override the value on the cmnda_pll0_fb_div_high signal.
Delta sigma bypass enable: When set to 1'b1, the delta sigma modulator will be bypassed, and the output will be the value specified for the internal pll_fb_div_integer signal.

PLL feedback divider override enable : When active (1'b1), the feedback divider low and high override values in the PLL 0 delta sigma modulator feedback divider value high override register mode 0 on page 102 and PLL 0 delta sigma modulator feedback divider value low override register mode 0 on page 102 registers will be used to override the feedback divider values driven to the analog.

PLL feedback divider latency adjustment: This signal specifies a value to be subtracted from the feedback divider settings before they are output on the cmnda_pll0_fb_div_high and cmnda_pll0_fb_div_low signals.

register.description: PLL 0 delta sigma modulator feedback divider value low override register mode 1

bitfield.description: PLL feedback divider low override value : When enabled by the PLL feedback divider override enable bit in the PLL 0 delta sigma modulator diagnostics register mode 0 on page 102, the value in this field will be used to override the value on the cmnda_pll0_fb_div_low signal.

register.description: PLL 0 spread spectrum control register 1 mode 1

bitfield.description: Amplitude step size: Value of the amplitude_step_size pin on the spread spectrum waveform generator.
Spread spectrum waveform generator disable: Setting this bit to a 1'b1 will disable the spread spectrum waveform generator.
Spread spectrum enable during VCO calibration : Setting this bit to a 1'b1 will enable the spread spectrum function while VCO calibration is taking place.

register.description: PLL 0 spread spectrum control register 3 mode 1

bitfield.description: Time step size: Value for the time_step_size pin on the spread spectrum waveform generator.
Number of steps: Value of the num_steps pin on the spread spectrum waveform generator.

register.description: PLL 1 VCO calibration control register

bitfield.description: VCO calibration initial step size control: This field specifies the initial step size for the VCO calibration state machine.
VCO calibration code starting point value: This field specifies the starting VCO code that is used by the VCO calibration state machine.
Start VCO calibration: Activating (1'b1) this bit will start a VCO calibration process.
VCO calibration process done: This bit will be set to 1'b1 when the VCO calibration process is complete.
VCO calibration code: This is the calibration code that was determined by the VCO calibration process.

register.description: PLL 1 VCO calibration timer control register

bitfield.description: VCO calibration code override enable: Activating (1'b1) this bit allows the VCO code determined during the automatic VCO calibration process to be overridden by the value driven by the VCO calibration code override value field in this register.
VCO calibration code override value: This field is used to override the VCO code determined during the automatic VCO calibration process.

VCO calibration initial time scale control: This field specifies the calibration start time scaling factor applied to the VCO calibration when running the initial step size for the calibration code if not set to 1.

register.description: PLL 1 VCO calibration initialization timer register

bitfield.description: Iteration wait timer value: This is the number of clocks to wait between when a calibration code is driven to the analog, and when the clock rates are measured.
Initialization wait timer value: This is the number of clocks to wait between when the analog VCO calibration circuits are enabled, and when the first calibration code is driven to the analog.

register.description: PLL 1 VCO calibration reference clock timer start value register

bitfield.description: PLL VCO calibration reference clock timer start value : This is the value that is loaded into the reference clock timer as the starting point for that timer, when running VCO calibration.

register.description: PLL 1 VCO calibration PLL clock counter start value register

bitfield.description: PLL VCO calibration PLL clock counter start value : This is the value that is loaded into the PLL clock counter as the starting point for that counter, when running VCO calibration.

register.description: PLL 1 feedback divider integer register mode 0

bitfield.description: pll_fb_div_fractional: Value of the pll_fb_div_fractional[15:0] signal.
pll_fb_div_integer value: Value of the pll_fb_div_integer signal.

register.description: PLL 1 feedback divider fractional high register mode 0

bitfield.description: pll_fb_div_high_theshold: Value of the pll_fb_div_high_threshold signal.
pll_fb_div_fractional: Value of the pll_fb_div_fractional[18:16] signal.

register.description: PLL 1 delta sigma modulator diagnostics register mode 0

bitfield.description: PLL feedback divider high override value : When enabled by the PLL feedback divider override enable bit in the PLL 1 delta sigma modulator diagnostics register mode 0 on page 111, the value in this field will be used to override the value on the cmnda_pll1_fb_div_high signal.
Delta sigma bypass enable: When set to 1'b1, the delta sigma modulator will be bypassed, and the output will be the value specified for the internal pll_fb_div_integer signal.

PLL feedback divider override enable : When active (1'b1), the feedback divider low and high override values in the PLL 1 delta sigma modulator feedback divider value high override register mode 0 on page 111 and PLL 1 delta sigma modulator feedback divider value low override register mode 0 on page 111 registers will be used to override the feedback divider values driven to the analog.

PLL feedback divider latency adjustment: This signal specifies a value to be subtracted from the feedback divider settings before they are output on the cmnda_pll1_fb_div_high and cmnda_pll1_fb_div_low signals.

register.description: PLL 1 delta sigma modulator feedback divider value low override register mode 0

bitfield.description: PLL feedback divider low override value : When enabled by the PLL feedback divider override enable bit in the PLL 1 delta sigma modulator diagnostics register mode 0 on page 111, the value in this field will be used to override the value on the cmnda_pll1_fb_div_low signal.

register.description: PLL 1 spread spectrum control register 1 mode 0

bitfield.description: Amplitude step size: Value of the amplitude_step_size pin on the spread spectrum waveform generator.
Spread spectrum waveform generator disable: Setting this bit to a 1'b1 will disable the spread spectrum waveform generator.
Spread spectrum enable during VCO calibration : Setting this bit to a 1'b1 will enable the spread spectrum function while VCO calibration is taking place.

register.description: PLL 1 spread spectrum control register 3 mode 0

bitfield.description: Time step size: Value for the time_step_size pin on the spread spectrum waveform generator.
Number of steps: Value of the num_steps pin on the spread spectrum waveform generator.

register.description: PLL 1 lock reference counter start value register

bitfield.description: PLL lock reference counter idle value : This is the value used by the PLL lock detection logic to specify the number of reference clocks between each phase of counting PLL clocks.
PLL lock reference counter start value : This is the value that is loaded into the PLL lock detect reference counter as the starting point for that counter, when checking for PLL lock.

register.description: PLL 1 lock PLL counter start value register

bitfield.description: PLL lock counter threshold value : This is the value used by the PLL lock detection logic to determine if the PLL has locked.
PLL lock PLL counter start value : This is the value that is loaded into the PLL lock detect PLL counter as the starting point for that counter, when checking for PLL lock.

register.description: TX pull-up resistor calibration control register

bitfield.description: Resistor code override enable: Activation (1'b1) of this register bit allows the resistor codes determined during the automatic resistor calibration process to be overridden.

Analog calibration enable override: Activation (1'b1) of this register bit will force the analog calibration circuits to be enabled by activating the cmnda_rescal_en_tx_useg enable and the cmnda_rescal_clk_tx_useg clock.
Resistor code override value: These bits are used to override the resistor code determined during the automatic resistor calibration process.
Start resistor calibration: Activating (1'b1) this bit will start the resistor calibration process.
Resistor calibration process done: This bit will be set to 1'b1 when the resistor calibration process is complete.

No analog calibration response : This signal indicates that the calibration function has gone through the entire calibration process, reached the final calibration value, and the analog has not responded indicating that a valid calibration value has been reached.
Current analog comparator response: This is the current state of the analog comparator response signal (cmnda_rescal_comp_tx_useg).
Resistor calibration code: This is the calibration code that was determined by the resistor calibration process.

register.description: TX pull-up resistor calibration start register

bitfield.description: Resistor calibration tune value: The value of this field is added to the automatically calibrated code, or the override code if override is enabled.
Resistor calibration direction: This controls the direction that the automatic calibration process steps the calibration codes in.
Start resistor calibration code: This is the calibration code that the resistor calibration process starts with when automatic calibration is run.

register.description: TX pull-up resistor calibration initialization timer register

bitfield.description: Iteration wait timer value: This is the number of cmn_ref_clk clocks to wait between when a value is placed on the resistor selection bus going to the analog, and when the comparator value coming from the analog circuits can be checked.

Initialization wait timer value: This is the number of cmn_ref_clk clocks to wait between when the analog resistor calibration circuits are enabled, and when the first resistor selection values are placed on the resistor selection bus, going to the analog.

Current analog comparator response: This is the current state of the analog comparator response signal (cmnda_rescal_comp_tx_dseg).
Resistor calibration code: This is the calibration code that was determined by the resistor calibration process.

bitfield.description: Resistor calibration tune value: The value of this field is added to the automatically calibrated code, or the override code if override is enabled.

Resistor calibration code: This is the calibration code that was determined by the resistor calibration process.

bitfield.description: Resistor calibration tune value: The value of this field is added to the automatically calibrated code, or the override code if override is enabled.
Resistor calibration direction: This controls the direction that the automatic calibration process steps the calibration codes in.
Start resistor calibration code: This is the calibration code that the resistor calibration process starts with when automatic calibration is run.

bitfield.description: Iteration wait timer value: This is the number of cmn_ref_clk clocks to wait between when a value is placed on the resistor selection bus going to the analog, and when the comparator value coming from the analog circuits can be checked.

register.description: Signal detect clock calibration control register

bitfield.description: Calibration initial step size control: This field specifies the initial step size for the calibration state machine.
Calibration code starting point value: This field specifies the starting code that is used by the calibration state machine.
Start calibration: Activating (1'b1) this bit will start a calibration process.
Calibration process done: This bit will be set to 1'b1 when the calibration process is complete.
Calibration code: This is the calibration code that was determined by the calibration process.

register.description: Signal detect clock calibration timer control register

bitfield.description: Calibration code override enable: Activating (1'b1) this bit allows the code determined during the automatic calibration process to be overridden by the value driven by the calibration code override value field in this register.
Calibration code override value: This field is used to override the code determined during the automatic calibration process.

Calibration initial time scale control: This field specifies the calibration start time scaling factor applied to the calibration when running the initial step size for the calibration code is not set to 1.

register.description: Signal detect clock calibration initialization timer register

bitfield.description: Iteration wait timer value: This is the number of clocks to wait between when a calibration code is driven to the analog, and when the clock rates are measured.
Initialization wait timer value: This is the number of clocks to wait between when the analog calibration circuits are enabled, and when the first calibration code is driven to the analog.

register.description: Signal detect clock calibration reference clock timer start value register

bitfield.description: Calibration reference clock timer start value : This is the value that is loaded into the reference clock timer as the starting point for that timer, when running calibration.

register.description: Signal detect clock calibration PLL clock counter start value register

bitfield.description: Calibration feedback clock counter start value : This is the value that is loaded into the PLL clock counter as the starting point for that counter, when running calibration.

register.description: Clock frequency measurement control register

bitfield.description: Test clock select: This field drives the test_clk_select pin, in order to control an external MUX for selecting between multiple test clocks to measure.
Run test clock measurement: Activating (1'b1) this bit will run the test clock measurement process.
Test clock measurement done: This bit will be set to 1'b1 when the test clock measurement process is complete.

register.description: Reference clock timer value register

bitfield.description: Test clock counter value: When the test clock measurement process is complete, the value in this field specifies the number of test clock cycles that were counted in the time specified by the reference clock timer value.
Reference clock timer value : This specifies the amount of time, in reference clock cycles, to count test clock cycles.

register.description: PLL 0 control register mode 0

bitfield.description: PLL 0 clock 1 divider enable: This bit enables the divider used to generate the cmnda_pll0_clk_1, from the PLL high speed clock.
PLL 0 clock 1 divider select: This field selects the divider value used to generate the cmnda_pll0_clk_1, from the PLL high speed clock, by driving the cmnda_pll0_clk_1_div_sel signal to the analog.

PLL 0 clock 0 and derived reference clock divider select: This field selects the divider value used to generate the cmnda_pll0_clk_0 and derived reference clock, from the PLL high speed clock, by driving the cmnda_pll0_clk_0_div_sel signal to the analog.
PLL 0 clock select: This field selects one of 3 possible high speed output clocks from PLL 0, to drive on the high speed analog clock 0, by driving the cmnda_pll0_clk_sel signal to the analog.
This field controls the Ring VCO Frequency drift with temperature.
PLL VCO select: Selects the VCO mode of operation, by driving the cmnda_pll0_vco_sel signal going into the common analog.

PLL feedback divider clock select: This signal selects which internal PLL clock will be used to drive the cmnda_pll0_fb_divider_clk, by driving the cmnda_pll0_fb_divider_clk_sel signal going into the common analog.
PLL feedback divider pre-scale: controls the feedback divider pre-scale, by driving the cmnda_pll0_div24_sel signal going into the common analog.
PLL PFD reset delay: Controls the minimum reset pulse width for the PFD.

register.description: PLL 0 override register mode 0

bitfield.description: PLL VCO bias current trim code: Controls the tank currents in the PLL LC tank circuit.

PLL VCO calibration enable override enable: When active (1'b1), the PLL VCO calibration enable override bit in this register, can be used to directly control the enable of the VCO calibration function in the PLL (instead of the VCO calibration module).

PLL VCO calibration enable override: When enabled by the PLL VCO calibration enable override enable bit in this register, this bit will directly control the enable of the VCO calibration function in the PLL.
PLL phase lock detect enable : Enables the diagnostic PLL phase lock detect function in the analog.
PLL phase lock detected : When enabled by the PLL phase lock detect enable bit in this register, this bit indicates that a PLL phase lock has been detected.

register.description: PLL 0 charge pump proportional path adjust register mode 0

bitfield.description: PLL charge pump integral path capacitance adjust: Adjusts the charge pump integral path capacitance, by driving the cmnda_pll0_cp_int_cap_adj signal going to the analog.
PLL charge pump integral path current adjust: Adjusts the charge pump integral path current, by driving the cmnda_pll0_cp_int_cur_adj signal going to the analog.
PLL charge pump proportional path capacitance adjust: Adjusts the charge pump proportional path capacitance, by driving the cmnda_pll0_cp_prop_cap_adj signal going to the analog.
PLL charge pump proportional path current adjust: Adjusts the charge pump proportional path current, by driving the cmnda_pll0_cp_prop_cur_adj signal going to the analog.

register.description: PLL 0 proportional path filter adjust register mode 0

bitfield.description: PLL charge pump calibration reference voltage tune: Adjusts the charge pump calibration reference voltage, by driving the cmnda_pll0_cp_vref_tune signal going to the analog.
PLL proportional path filter capacitance adjust: Adjusts the proportional path filter capacitance, by driving the cmnda_pll0_filt_c_adj signal going to the analog.
PLL proportional path filter resistance adjust: Adjusts the proportional path filter resistance, by driving the cmnda_pll0_filt_r_adj signal going to the analog.

register.description: Bandgap override register

bitfield.description: Receiver resistor calibration current adjust: This field is used to adjust the receiver resistor calibration bias current.
Transmitter resistor calibration current adjust: This field is used to adjust the transmitter resistor calibration bias current.
Reserved - spare
Reserved - spare
Bandgap startup circuit startup count : Identifies the status of the bandgap startup counter.
Bandgap startup circuit select : Selects the startup circuit to be used for the bias / bandgap circuits, by driving the cmnda_bias_bg_start_sel signal going to the analog.
Bandgap startup circuit sense voltage adjust : This field is used to adjust the bandgap startup circuit sense voltage, by driving the cmnda_bias_bg_start_adj signal to the analog.
Bandgap voltage adjust : This field is used to adjust the bandgap voltage, by driving the cmnda_bias_bg_adj signal to the analog.

register.description: Bias override register 2

bitfield.description: Voltage regulator reference voltage select: Selects the reference voltage used for the voltage regulator in common, by driving the cmnda_vreg_ref_sel signal to the analog.
Bias filter bypass enable override enable: When active (1'b1), the bias filter bypass enable override bit in this register, can be used to directly control the bias filter bypass enable function.
Bias filter bypass enable override: When enabled by the bias filter bypass enable override enable bit in this register, this bit will directly control the bias filter bypass enable function.
Regulator bandgap reference voltage adjust: This field is used to adjust the regulator bandgap reference voltage, by driving the cmnda_bias_vreg_adj signal to the analog.

register.description: Common process monitor control register

bitfield.description: Bandgap up value: Bandgap calibration up signal value, as it is currently captured in the sample and hold latches.
Bandgap auto zero select value: Bandgap calibration auto zero select signal value, as it is currently captured in the sample and hold latches.
Process monitor enable: Enables the analog process monitor, by driving the cmnda_pcm_en signal to the analog.
Process monitor mode select: Selects the mode of the analog process monitor, by driving the cmnda_pcm_sel signal to the analog.

register.description: Sample and hold resistor calibration code register

bitfield.description: Signal detect clock code: Signal detect clock calibration code signal value, as it is currently captured in the sample and hold latches.
TX resistor code: TX resistor calibration code signal value, as it is currently captured in the sample and hold latches.
RX resistor code: RX resistor calibration code signal value, as it is currently captured in the sample and hold latches.

register.description: ATB control register 1

bitfield.description: ATB component type select: These bits specify which component type is currently selected by the ATB, as specified below.
ATB component sub address: Specifies the sub address of the component being selected.
ATB test point address: Specifies the exact point in the selected analog component to be observed.
Core side ATB enable: When active (1'b) and the ATB enable bit in this register is also active, the ATB signals will be driven on the core side ATB signals.
ATB enable: When active (1'b1), the ATB test function is enabled.

register.description: ATB ADC control register 0

bitfield.description: ATB ADC offset correction enable : Enables internal auto generated offset correction mode, by driving the cmnda_atba2d_en_off_cor signal to the analog.
ATB ADC force cap values : Forces a positive or negative voltage on the internal cap, by driving the cmnda_atba2d_frc_val signal to the analog.

ATB ADC enable manual offset correction : When this signal is active, the value in the ATB ADC manual offset correction value field of this register is used to manually control the offset correction, by driving the cmnda_atba2d_off_byp_en signal to the analog.

ATB ADC manual offset correction value : When the ATB ADC enable manual offset correction bit in this register is active, this field is used to manually control the offset correction, by driving the cmnda_atba2d_off_adj_byp signal to the analog.
ATB ADC mode : This field indicates the mode the analog to digital converter is in.
ATB analog ADC enable: This enables the analog ADC function, by driving the cmnda_atba2d_en signal to the analog.
Start ATB ADC process: Activating (1'b1) this bit will start the ATB ADC process.
ATB ADC process done: This bit will be set to 1'b1 when the ATB ADC process is complete, and the data in the ATB ADC code field of this register is considered valid.
ATB ADC data code: This is the digital code representing the level of the analog ATB signal that was digitized by the analog ADC.

Current state of the cmn_pll0_lock_det_ref_clk_reset_n reset.
Transceiver reset delay : Species the number of PSM clock cycles the transceiver common high speed reset state machine stays in the delay state.
Transmitter reset delay : Species the number of PSM clock cycles the transmitter common high speed reset state machine stays in the delay state.

register.description: The SERDES Type C control register allows the external lanes selection to be swapped.

register.description: The Lane Control Register sets the lane specific modes of operation.

bitfield.description: The p0_enable is AND'd with the IPx_LNy_reset_n to enable the lane.
The p0_force_enable is OR'd with the IPx_LNy_reset_n to force enable the lane.
The p0_align will auto align the RAW interface to 8B10B comma characters.
The p0_raw_auto_start will auto sequence the RAW interface according to the configuration settings
Standard Mode
Full Rate divider for 2x MAC speed mode.

Fclk Select determines which clocks will be used for the IP rxfclk signal.

register.description: Power state machine control register Offset = 4000h + (j * 400h); where j = 0h to 3h

bitfield.description: RX reset active ready : Controls the state the receiver reset is changed to when in the ready power state.
RX reset active calibration : Controls the state the receiver reset is changed to when in the calibration power state.
RX reset active A5 : Controls the state the receiver reset is changed to when in the A5 entry power state.
RX reset active A4 : Controls the state the receiver reset is changed to when in the A4 entry power state.
RX reset active A3 : Controls the state the receiver reset is changed to when in the A3 entry power state.
RX reset active A2 : Controls the state the receiver reset is changed to when in the A2 entry power state.
RX reset active A1 : Controls the state the receiver reset is changed to when in the A1 entry power state.
RX reset active A0 : Controls the state the receiver reset is changed to when in the A0 entry power state.
TX reset active ready : Controls the state the transmitter reset is changed to when in the ready power state.
TX reset active calibration : Controls the state the transmitter reset is changed to when in the calibration power state.
TX reset active A5 : Controls the state the transmitter reset is changed to when in the A5 entry power state.
TX reset active A4 : Controls the state the transmitter reset is changed to when in the A4 entry power state.
TX reset active A3 : Controls the state the transmitter reset is changed to when in the A3 entry power state.
TX reset active A2 : Controls the state the transmitter reset is changed to when in the A2 entry power state.
TX reset active A1 : Controls the state the transmitter reset is changed to when in the A1 entry power state.
TX reset active A0 : Controls the state the transmitter reset is changed to when in the A0 entry power state.
Bypass A0 in delay from PSM ready : When this bit is active (1'b1), the A0 input delay is bypassed when transitioning from the PSM ready state to the A0 power state.
Bypass A0 in delay from A5 : When this bit is active (1'b1), the A0 input delay is bypassed when transitioning from the A5 to the A0 power state.
Bypass A0 in delay from A4 : When this bit is active (1'b1), the A0 input delay is bypassed when transitioning from the A4 to the A0 power state.
Bypass A0 in delay from A3 : When this bit is active (1'b1), the A0 input delay is bypassed when transitioning from the A3 to the A0 power state.
Bypass A0 in delay from A2 : When this bit is active (1'b1), the A0 input delay is bypassed when transitioning from the A2 to the A0 power state.
Bypass A0 in delay from A1 : When this bit is active (1'b1), the A0 input delay is bypassed when transitioning from the A1 to the A0 power state.
Reserved - spare (must remain set to 1'b1).

register.description: TX coefficient controller control register Offset = 4080h + (j * 400h); where j = 0h to 3h

bitfield.description: Pre-cursor override enable: When enabled, the pre-cursor field in this register is used to override the pre-cursor value.
Pre-cursor override value: When enabled by the pre-cursor override enable bit in this register, the value in this field is used to override the pre-cursor value.
Margin multiplier rounding control: This field controls the rounding function on the margin multiplier.
LF value multiplier rounding control: This field controls the rounding function on the LF value multiplier.
Calculated post-emphasis multiplier rounding control: This field controls the rounding function on the calculated post-emphasis multiplier.
Calculated pre-emphasis multiplier rounding control: This field controls the rounding function on the pre-emphasis multiplier.
Coefficient calculator multiplier rounding control: This field controls the rounding function on the coefficient calculator multiplier.
De-emphasis control standard mode 3 value: This bit controls the de-emphasis mode when the xcvr_standard_mode is set to 2'b11.
De-emphasis control standard mode 2 value: This bit controls the de-emphasis mode when the xcvr_standard_mode is set to 2'b10.
De-emphasis control standard mode 1 value: This bit controls the de-emphasis mode when the xcvr_standard_mode is set to 2'b01.
De-emphasis control standard mode 0 value: This bit controls the de-emphasis mode when the xcvr_standard_mode is set to 2'b00.

Main-cursor override enable: When enabled, the main-cursor field in this register is used to override the main-cursor value.

register.description: Lane fast common mode enable margin timer register Offset = 4184h + (j * 400h); where j = 0h to 3h

bitfield.description: Common mode sense reference DAC voltage initial test: This field sets the common mode detect reference voltage for the common mode detect comparator, when the fast establishment of common mode function is checking the initial state of the txda_cm_sense_comp_out signal.

Common mode sense reference DAC voltage high test: This field sets the common mode detect reference voltage for the common mode detect comparator, when the fast establishment of common mode function is waiting for the txda_cm_sense_comp_out signal from the analog to be driven high.

Common mode sense reference DAC voltage low test: This field sets the common mode detect reference voltage for the common mode detect comparator, when the fast establishment of common mode function is waiting for the txda_cm_sense_comp_out signal from the analog to be driven low.
Lane fast common mode enable margin timer value: This specifies the number of reference clock cycles the fast establishment of common mode process will enable all the margin segments for.

register.description: Transmitter LFPS control register Offset = 4188h + (j * 400h); where j = 0h to 3h

bitfield.description: Receiver detect comparators output and or control: This bit controls how the receiver detect comparators are used to drive the txda_rcvdet_detected_n signal to the digital.
Receiver detect reference DAC voltage: This field sets the receiver detect reference voltage for the receiver detect comparator.
LFPS half period clocks: Specifies the number of clock cycles required to implement one half of a LFPS period, by the transmitter LFPS controller.

register.description: TX driver diagnostic register Offset = 418Ch + (j * 400h); where j = 0h to 3h

bitfield.description: TX boost enable: Increases the transmitter amplitude for fast data transitions, by controlling the txda_drv_boost_en signal going to the analog.

TX boost tune: Controls the transmitter boost amplitude when the transmitter boost function is enabled using the TX boost enable bit in this register, by controlling the txda_drv_boost_tune signal going to the analog.
TX pre-driver pull up control: When the pre-driver is disabled, this bit controls the state of the pre-driver output, by controlling the txda_drv_predrv_pullup signal going to the analog.
TX driver margin type: Selects the margining type the driver will operate in, by controlling the txda_drv_margin_type signal going to the analog.

register.description: Transceiver power island control timer register Offset = 41C0h + (j * 400h); where j = 0h to 3h

bitfield.description: Power island controller input override enable: When enabled, the power island control state machine input override bits in this register will drive the power island control state machine directly, and override any control from other state machines in the macro.

Power island controller output override enable: When enabled, the power island control state machine output override bits in this register will drive the power island control state machine outputs, and override any control from power island control state machine.
Power suspend request override: When enabled, this bit will override the power_suspend_req input of the power island control state machine.
Power suspend acknowledge: This is the current state of the power_suspend_ack output from the power island control state machine.
Power recover request override: When enabled, this bit will override the power_recover_req input of the power island control state machine.
Power recover acknowledge: This is the current state of the power_recover_ack output from the power island control state machine.
Power island controller output override: When enabled, the bits in this field will override the output signals from the power island control state machine.

Power enable phase 2 timer value: This specifies the number of PSM clock cycles the power island control state machines in the transceiver will wait in the power phase 2 enable states, in order to allow enough time for the second phase of the switched domain to power up, before deactivating the isolation functions.

Power enable phase 1 timer value: This specifies the number of PSM clock cycles the power island control state machines in the transceiver will wait in the power phase 1 enable states, in order to allow enough time for the first phase of the switched domain to power up, before enabling the second phase of the power up.

register.description: Transceiver transceiver calibration power island control status register Offset = 41C4h + (j * 400h); where j = 0h to 3h

bitfield.description: Power island controller input override enable: When enabled, the power island control state machine input override bits in this register will drive the power island control state machine directly, and override any control from other state machines in the macro.

Power island controller output override enable: When enabled, the power island control state machine output override bits in this register will drive the power island control state machine outputs, and override any control from power island control state machine.
Power suspend request override: When enabled, this bit will override the power_suspend_req input of the power island control state machine.
Power suspend acknowledge: This is the current state of the power_suspend_ack output from the power island control state machine.
Power recover request override: When enabled, this bit will override the power_recover_req input of the power island control state machine.
Power recover acknowledge: This is the current state of the power_recover_ack output from the power island control state machine.
Power island controller output override: When enabled, the bits in this field will override the output signals from the power island control state machine.
Power island controller output status: This field indicates the current state of the output signals from the power island control state machine.

register.description: Transceiver transceiver data path power island control status register Offset = 41C8h + (j * 400h); where j = 0h to 3h

bitfield.description: Digital PLL clock select standard mode 3: This bit controls which full rate PLL clock is selected, when xcvr_standard_mode is set to 2'b11.

Digital PLL data rate divider standard mode 3 value: This field will directly control the xcvr_pll_clk_datart_div signal, which controls which divided clock is selected when generating the xcvr_pll_clk_datart clock, when xcvr_standard_mode is set to 2'b11.
Digital PLL clock select standard mode 2: This bit controls which full rate PLL clock is selected, when xcvr_standard_mode is set to 2'b10.

Digital PLL data rate divider standard mode 2 value: This field will directly control the xcvr_pll_clk_datart_div signal, which controls which divided clock is selected when generating the xcvr_pll_clk_datart clock, when xcvr_standard_mode is set to 2'b10.
Digital PLL clock select standard mode 1: This bit controls which full rate PLL clock is selected, when xcvr_standard_mode is set to 2'b01.

Digital PLL data rate divider standard mode 1 value: This field will directly control the xcvr_pll_clk_datart_div signal, which controls which divided clock is selected when generating the xcvr_pll_clk_datart clock, when xcvr_standard_mode is set to 2'b01.
Digital PLL clock select standard mode 0: This bit controls which full rate PLL clock is selected, when xcvr_standard_mode is set to 2'b00.

Digital PLL data rate divider standard mode 0 value: This field will directly control the xcvr_pll_clk_datart_div signal, which controls which divided clock is selected when generating the xcvr_pll_clk_datart clock, when xcvr_standard_mode is set to 2'b00.
Power island controller output status: This field indicates the current state of the output signals from the power island control state machine.

register.description: Transceiver high speed clock select register Offset = 41CCh + (j * 400h); where j = 0h to 3h

bitfield.description: Transceiver clock divider select standard mode 3: This field selects the divider value used to divide the selected analog high speed clock by when generating the transmit and receive clocks, when xcvr_standard_mode is set to 2'b11, by driving the xcvrda_xcvr_clk_div_sel signal to the analog, as specified below.

Transceiver clock divider select standard mode 2: This field selects the divider value used to divide the selected analog high speed clock by when generating the transmit and receive clocks, when xcvr_standard_mode is set to 2'b10, by driving the xcvrda_xcvr_clk_div_sel signal to the analog, as specified below.

Transceiver clock divider select standard mode 1: This field selects the divider value used to divide the selected analog high speed clock by when generating the transmit and receive clocks, when xcvr_standard_mode is set to 2'b01, by driving the xcvrda_xcvr_clk_div_sel signal to the analog, as specified below.

Transceiver clock divider select standard mode 0: This field selects the divider value used to divide the selected analog high speed clock by when generating the transmit and receive clocks, when xcvr_standard_mode is set to 2'b00, by driving the xcvrda_xcvr_clk_div_sel signal to the analog, as specified below.

High speed clock select standard mode 3: This specifies which analog high speed clock is selected when xcvr_standard_mode is set to 2'b11, by driving the xcvrda_clk_sel signal to the analog, as specified below.

High speed clock select standard mode 2: This specifies which analog high speed clock is selected when xcvr_standard_mode is set to 2'b10, by driving the xcvrda_clk_sel signal to the analog, as specified below.

High speed clock select standard mode 1: This specifies which analog high speed clock is selected when xcvr_standard_mode is set to 2'b01, by driving the xcvrda_clk_sel signal to the analog, as specified below.

High speed clock select standard mode 0: This specifies which analog high speed clock is selected when xcvr_standard_mode is set to 2'b00, by driving the xcvrda_clk_sel signal to the analog, as specified below.

register.description: TX clock control register Offset = 41D0h + (j * 400h); where j = 0h to 3h

bitfield.description: RX deserializer clock invert: This bit is used to optionally invert the deserializer clock (rxda_des_clk) for diagnostic purposes.
RX 2x clock enable: This bit enables the receiver 2x clock function, by driving the rxda_des_clk_2x_en signal going to the analog.
RX PI E path clock select: Controls which PI clock drives the E path clocks, by driving the rxda_pi_i_drv_e_en signal going to the analog.
PI output clock divider enable standard mode 3: This bit controls the rxda_pi_out_clk_div_en to enable the PI output clock divider, when xcvr_standard_mode is set to 2'b11.
PI output clock divider enable standard mode 2: This bit controls the rxda_pi_out_clk_div_en to enable the PI output clock divider, when xcvr_standard_mode is set to 2'b10.
PI output clock divider enable standard mode 1: This bit controls the rxda_pi_out_clk_div_en to enable the PI output clock divider, when xcvr_standard_mode is set to 2'b01.
PI output clock divider enable standard mode 0: This bit controls the rxda_pi_out_clk_div_en to enable the PI output clock divider, when xcvr_standard_mode is set to 2'b00.
TX serializer clock invert: This bit is used to optionally invert the serializer clock (txda_ser_clk) for diagnostic purposes.

register.description: Transceiver bidirectional control register Offset = 41D4h + (j * 400h); where j = 0h to 3h

bitfield.description: Receiver DFE enable mask value standard mode 3: This bit will controls the rx_dfe_eq_enable_std_mask digital signal, which can be used to mask off the rxda_dfe_eq_enable signal coming from the power state controller and going into the analog, when xcvr_standard_mode is set to 2'b11.

Receiver DFE enable mask value standard mode 2: This bit will controls the rx_dfe_eq_enable_std_mask digital signal, which can be used to mask off the rxda_dfe_eq_enable signal coming from the power state controller and going into the analog, when xcvr_standard_mode is set to 2'b10.

Receiver DFE enable mask value standard mode 1: This bit will controls the rx_dfe_eq_enable_std_mask digital signal, which can be used to mask off the rxda_dfe_eq_enable signal coming from the power state controller and going into the analog, when xcvr_standard_mode is set to 2'b01.

Receiver DFE enable mask value standard mode 0: This bit will controls the rx_dfe_eq_enable_std_mask digital signal, which can be used to mask off the rxda_dfe_eq_enable signal coming from the power state controller and going into the analog, when xcvr_standard_mode is set to 2'b00.
Receiver enable standard mode 3: When bidirectional bumps are implemented in the transceiver, this bit is a global enable for the receiver function, when xcvr_standard_mode is set to 2'b11.
Receiver enable standard mode 2: When bidirectional bumps are implemented in the transceiver, this bit is a global enable for the receiver function, when xcvr_standard_mode is set to 2'b10.
Receiver enable standard mode 1: When bidirectional bumps are implemented in the transceiver, this bit is a global enable for the receiver function, when xcvr_standard_mode is set to 2'b01.
Receiver enable standard mode 0: When bidirectional bumps are implemented in the transceiver, this bit is a global enable for the receiver function, when xcvr_standard_mode is set to 2'b00.
Transmitter enable standard mode 3: When bidirectional bumps are implemented in the transceiver, this bit is a global enable for the transmitter function, when xcvr_standard_mode is set to 2'b11.
Transmitter enable standard mode 2: When bidirectional bumps are implemented in the transceiver, this bit is a global enable for the transmitter function, when xcvr_standard_mode is set to 2'b10.
Transmitter enable standard mode 1: When bidirectional bumps are implemented in the transceiver, this bit is a global enable for the transmitter function, when xcvr_standard_mode is set to 2'b01.
Transmitter enable standard mode 0: When bidirectional bumps are implemented in the transceiver, this bit is a global enable for the transmitter function, when xcvr_standard_mode is set to 2'b00.

register.description: Transceiver control reset diagnostic register Offset = 41D8h + (j * 400h); where j = 0h to 3h

bitfield.description: Transceiver clock enable delay timer value: This specifies the number of xcvr_psm_clk clock cycles that the transceiver high speed clock reset release state machine will wait between when it drives the analog transceiver clock enable signal active, and when it will initiate the process to release the reset for this clock.
Current state of the tx_coef_calc_reset_n reset.
Current state of the xcvr_psm_reset_n reset.
Current state of the xcvr_ref_clk_reset_n reset.

register.description: Transceiver digital cover your alternatives register Offset = 41DCh + (j * 400h); where j = 0h to 3h

bitfield.description: Reserved - spare

register.description: Transmitter A0 power state definition register Offset = 4200h + (j * 400h); where j = 0h to 3h

bitfield.description: TX driver common mode enable extend control
Force txda_lfps_sel active
LFPS clock gate enable
Reserved - spare
Transmitter low current mode
Transmitter mission mode enable
TX driver common mode enable
TX driver enable
TX post-emphasis enable (C+1)
TX pre-emphasis enable (C-1)
TX pre-driver enable
TX serializer enable

TX driver common mode enable extend control: Specifies which power states the tx_cmn_mode_en_ext signal is considered valid in and can be used to force the driver to continue to be in the common mode state.
Force txda_lfps_sel active: Setting this bit forces the txda_lfps_sel signal going to the analog to be driven active.
LFPS clock gate enable: Enables the LFPS clock gate when an LFPS clock is required.
Reserved - spare
Transmitter low current mode: Enables a low current consumption mode within the common mode voltage circuit in the driver, via the txda_drv_idle_lowi_en signal going to the analog.
Transmitter mission mode enable: Enables the analog circuits in the driver required to run in mission mode, via the txda_drv_mission_en signal going to the analog.
TX driver common mode enable: Enables the common mode voltage circuits in the driver.
TX driver enable: Enables the transmitter driver, via the H bridge driver controller.
TX post-emphasis enable (C+1): Enables the transmitter circuits related to the post-emphasis function.
TX pre-emphasis enable (C-1): Enables the transmitter circuits related to the pre-emphasis function.
TX pre-driver enable: Enables the transmitter pre-driver, driver data selection MUX, and receiver detect.
TX serializer enable: Enables the serializer and related clock divider circuits.
