register.description: Transmit receiver detect control register Offset = 4240h + (j * 400h); where j = 0h to 3h

bitfield.description: Receiver detect override enable: Activation (1'b1) of this register bit enables the tx_rcv_detected output from the receiver detect state machine to be driven directly by the receiver detect override bit in this register.

Receiver detect override: When the receiver detect override enable bit in this register is active (1'b1), this bit will directly control the tx_rcv_detected output from the receiver detect state machine.
Start receiver detect: Activating (1'b1) this bit will start the receiver detect process.
Receiver detect process done: This bit will be set to 1'b1 when the receiver detect process is complete.
Receiver detected: When the receiver detect process is complete, this register bit will indicate the current state of the tx_rcv_detected pin.

register.description: Transmit receiver detect enable timer register Offset = 4244h + (j * 400h); where j = 0h to 3h

bitfield.description: Start wait time value: This is the number of clocks the receiver detect state machine waits between driving the txda_rcvdet_start signal active and checking the results on the txda_rcvdet_detected_n signal coming from the analog.

Enable wait time value: This is the number of clocks the receiver detect state machine waits between driving the txda_rcvdet_en signal active and driving the txda_rcvdet_start signal active going to the analog.

register.description: Transmit BIST control register Offset = 4280h + (j * 400h); where j = 0h to 3h

bitfield.description: Transmitter BIST user defined data: Writing a data word to this field will result in that data word being placed in the next available position in the transmitter BIST user defined data FIFO.
Transmitter BIST mode: Controls which mode the BIST will operate in.

Transmitter BIST force error: When this bit transitions from 1'b0 to 1'b1, the transmit BIST controller will force an error to be transmitted from the BIST logic, by inverting one of the parallel data bits.
Transmitter BIST user defined data FIFO clear: Writing a 1'b1 to this bit will clear the transmitter BIST user defined data FIFO.
Transmitter BIST enable: This bit enables the transmitter BIST function.

register.description: Transmit BIST PRBS seed 0 register Offset = 4284h + (j * 400h); where j = 0h to 3h

bitfield.description: Transmitter BIST PRBS seed (30:16): When the BIST is in PRBS mode, this field provides a seed for the PRBS, such that different lanes can have different BIST patterns.
Transmitter BIST PRBS seed (15:0): When the BIST is in PRBS mode, this field provides a seed for the PRBS, such that different lanes can have different BIST patterns.

register.description: TX sync FIFO diagnostic control register Offset = 43C0h + (j * 400h); where j = 0h to 3h

bitfield.description: FIFO alignment settle delay: This field specifies the number of clocks to wait for a prior change to the enqueue pointer to complete before initiating the check phase of the alignment procedure in the sync FIFO.
FIFO alignment detect delay: This field specifies the number of clocks to wait in the delay state for each phase of the alignment procedure in the sync FIFO.
FIFO enqueue pointer bump: This bit can be used to decrement the enqueue pointer relative to the dequeue pointer, for diagnostic purposes.
FIFO pointers overlapping: This bit indicates that the current enqueue and dequeue pointers have been detected as overlapping.

FIFO alignment acknowledge: This bit indicates that the FIFO alignment process is complete, as initiated either automatically by the hardware of the FIFO alignment enable override bits in this register.
FIFO alignment enable override enable: This bit enables the FIFO alignment enable override register to drive the fifo_align_en pin of the FIFO directly for diagnostic purposes.

FIFO alignment enable override: When enabled by the FIFO alignment enable override enable bit in this register, this bit directly controls the fifo_align_en pin of the FIFO to provide a means of running the FIFO alignment function for diagnostic purposes.

register.description: TX electrical idle diagnostic register Offset = 43C4h + (j * 400h); where j = 0h to 3h

bitfield.description: TX electrical idle exit delay 16 bit data width : This field controls the amount of additional delay added to the electrical idle signal after the sync FIFO, when exiting the electrical idle state for 16 bit data width modes.

TX electrical idle entry delay 16 bit data width : This field controls the amount of additional delay added to the electrical idle signal after the sync FIFO, when entering the electrical idle state for 16 bit data width modes.

TX electrical idle exit delay 20 bit data width : This field controls the amount of additional delay added to the electrical idle signal after the sync FIFO, when exiting the electrical idle state for 20 bit data width modes.

TX electrical idle entry delay 20 bit data width : This field controls the amount of additional delay added to the electrical idle signal after the sync FIFO, when entering the electrical idle state for 20 bit data width modes.

register.description: Transmitter control reset diagnostic register Offset = 43C8h + (j * 400h); where j = 0h to 3h

bitfield.description: Current state of the txda_tx_clk_reset_n reset.
Current state of the tx_dig_reset_n reset.
Current state of the tx_sync_fifo_deq_rst_n reset.
Current state of the tx_sync_fifo_enq_rst_n reset.
Current state of the tx_lfps_reset_n reset.

register.description: Transmitter digital cover your alternatives register Offset = 43CCh + (j * 400h); where j = 0h to 3h

bitfield.description: Reserved - spare

HBDC latch control: Controls the state of the latches associated with the H bridge driver controller related signals in the H bridge driver encoder logic digital in the transmitter analog, as well as the boost enable and level control signals.
Reserved - spare

register.description: Receiver A0 power state definition register Offset = 8000h + (j * 400h); where j = 0h to 3h

bitfield.description: RX signal detect enable extend control
RX signal detect filter enable
RX LFPS detect filter enable
Reserved - spare
RX signal detect enable
Reserved - spare
RX equalizer engine enable
RX DFE equalization enable.
RX PI enable
RX e path enable (calibration and eye surf only)
RX enable
RX signal detect enable extend control: Specifies which power states the rx_sig_det_en_ext signal is considered valid in and can be used to force the signal detect functions to remain on.
RX signal detect filter enable: Enables the receiver signal detect filter function in the digital receiver controller.
RX LFPS detect filter enable: Enables the receiver LFPS detect filter function in the digital receiver controller.
Reserved - spare
RX signal detect enable: Enables the receiver signal detect function.
Reserved - spare
RX equalizer engine enable: Specifies which power state the REE runs in.
RX DFE equalization enable: Enables the receiver DFE equalization circuits, via the rxda_dfe_eq_enable signal.
RX PI enable: Enables the receiver circuits related to the PI and associated clocking components.
RX e path enable (calibration and eye surf only) : Enables the receiver circuits related to the eye plot PI and e path deserializer for calibration and eye surf.
RX enable: Enables the receiver circuits related to the CDRLF, Sampler, FE, and Deserializer.

register.description: Signal detect calibration 0 control register Offset = 8080h + (j * 400h); where j = 0h to 3h

bitfield.description: Calibration code override enable: Activation (1'b1) of this register bit allows the codes determined during the automatic calibration process to be overridden.

Analog calibration enable override: Activation (1'b1) of this register bit will force the analog calibration circuits to be enabled by activating the rxda_sd_cal_0_en enable and the rxda_sd_cal_0_clk clock.
Calibration code override value: These bits are used to override the calibration code determined during the automatic calibration process.
Start calibration: Activating (1'b1) this bit will start the calibration process.
Calibration process done: This bit will be set to 1'b1 when the calibration process is complete.

No analog calibration response : This signal indicates that the calibration function has gone through the entire calibration process, reached the final calibration value, and the analog has not responded indicating that a valid calibration value has been reached.
Current analog comparator response: This is the current state of the analog comparator response signal (rxda_sd_cal_0_comp).
Calibration code: This is the calibration code that was determined by the calibration process.

register.description: Signal detect calibration 0 start register Offset = 8084h + (j * 400h); where j = 0h to 3h

bitfield.description: Calibration tune value: The value of this field is added to the automatically calibrated code, or the override code if override is enabled.
Calibration direction: This controls the direction that the automatic calibration process steps the calibration codes in.
Start calibration code: This is the calibration code that the calibration process starts with when automatic calibration is run.

register.description: Signal detect calibration 0 initialization timer register Offset = 8088h + (j * 400h); where j = 0h to 3h

bitfield.description: Iteration wait timer value: This is the number of cmn_ref_clk clocks to wait between when a value is placed on the calibration code signals going to the analog, and when the comparator value coming from the analog circuits can be checked.

Initialization wait timer value: This is the number of cmn_ref_clk clocks to wait between when the analog calibration circuits are enabled, and when the first values are placed on the calibration code signals going to the analog.

register.description: Signal detect calibration 1 control register Offset = 8090h + (j * 400h); where j = 0h to 3h

bitfield.description: Calibration code override enable: Activation (1'b1) of this register bit allows the calibration code determined during the automatic calibration process to be overridden.

Analog calibration enable override: Activation (1'b1) of this register bit will force the analog calibration circuits to be enabled by activating the rxda_sd_cal_1_en enable and the rxda_sd_cal_1_clk clock.
Calibration code override value: These bits are used to override the calibration code determined during the automatic calibration process.
Start calibration: Activating (1'b1) this bit will start the calibration process.
Calibration process done: This bit will be set to 1'b1 when the calibration process is complete.

No analog calibration response : This signal indicates that the calibration function has gone through the entire calibration process, reached the final calibration value, and the analog has not responded indicating that a valid calibration value has been reached.
Current analog comparator response: This is the current state of the analog comparator response signal (rxda_sd_cal_0_comp).
Calibration code: This is the calibration code that was determined by the calibration process.

register.description: Signal detect calibration 1 start register Offset = 8094h + (j * 400h); where j = 0h to 3h

bitfield.description: Calibration tune value: The value of this field is added to the automatically calibrated code, or the override code if override is enabled.
Calibration direction: This controls the direction that the automatic calibration process steps the calibration codes in.
Start calibration code: This is the calibration code that the calibration process starts with when automatic calibration is run.

register.description: Signal detect calibration 1 initialization timer register Offset = 8098h + (j * 400h); where j = 0h to 3h

bitfield.description: Iteration wait timer value: This is the number of cmn_ref_clk clocks to wait between when a value is placed on the calibration code signals going to the analog, and when the comparator value coming from the analog circuits can be checked.

Initialization wait timer value: This is the number of cmn_ref_clk clocks to wait between when the analog calibration circuits are enabled, and when the first values are placed on the calibration code signals going to the analog.

register.description: Sampler error DAC control register Offset = 80B0h + (j * 400h); where j = 0h to 3h

bitfield.description: Sampler error DAC value: Specifies the input value to the sampler error DAC.

register.description: RX sampler latch calibration control register Offset = 80C0h + (j * 400h); where j = 0h to 3h

bitfield.description: I even latch receiver sampler calibration DAC value: This field contains the current value that the RX sampler latch calibration module has calculated to drive to the DAC that controls the offset for the I even latch in the analog sampler component.

I odd latch receiver sampler calibration DAC value: This field contains the current value that the RX sampler latch calibration module has calculated to drive to the DAC that controls the offset for the I odd latch in the analog sampler component.
Start RX sampler latch calibration: Activating (1'b1) this bit will start the RX sampler latch calibration process.
RX sampler latch calibration process done: This bit will be set to 1'b1 when the RX sampler latch calibration process is complete.
RX sampler latch calibration scaler: This field specifies the scaler value used for the input data accumulator.

register.description: RX sampler latch calibration e predictive negative override register Offset = 80D8h + (j * 400h); where j = 0h to 3h

bitfield.description: RX sampler latch calibration initialization timer value : This is the value that will be used for the RX sampler latch calibration initialization timer, which controls the time the rxda_sampler_latch_cal_en is held active prior to the individual calibration processes being kicked off.

e even latch receiver sampler calibration DAC override enable: When this bit is active (1'b1), the value in the e even latch receiver sampler calibration DAC override value field of this register will override the calibrated value for the e even sampler latch.
e even latch receiver sampler calibration DAC override value: This field contains the value that can be used to override the calibrated value for the e even sampler latch.

register.description: RX sampler latch calibration run timer value register Offset = 80DCh + (j * 400h); where j = 0h to 3h

bitfield.description: Diagnostic control enable : This bit enables the selected RX sampler latch calibration data sub module for diagnostic purposes.

Voter override neg : When enabled using the voter override enable bit in this register, writing a 1'b1 in this register bit will force the voter in the selected RX sampler latch calibration data sub module to activate the voter neg signal for a single clock cycle.

Voter override pos : When enabled using the voter override enable bit in this register, writing a 1'b1 in this register bit will force the voter in the selected RX sampler latch calibration data sub module to activate the voter pos signal for a single clock cycle.
Voter override enable : Setting this bit to a 1'b1 will enable the voter override function in the selected RX sampler latch calibration data sub module.
Diagnostic control override select : Selects the RX sampler latch calibration data sub module to enable for diagnostic and verification purposes.
RX sampler latch calibration run timer value : This is the value that will be used for the RX sampler latch calibration run timer, which controls the run time for each calibration process.

register.description: RX sampler latch calibration disable register Offset = 80E0h + (j * 400h); where j = 0h to 3h

bitfield.description: e even negative coefficient disable : Writing a 1'b1 to this bit will disable auto calibration for the e even negative coefficient RX sampler latch calibration data sub module.
q even negative coefficient disable : Writing a 1'b1 to this bit will disable auto calibration for the q even negative coefficient RX sampler latch calibration data sub module.
i even negative coefficient disable : Writing a 1'b1 to this bit will disable auto calibration for the i even negative coefficient RX sampler latch calibration data sub module.
e even positive coefficient disable : Writing a 1'b1 to this bit will disable auto calibration for the e even positive coefficient RX sampler latch calibration data sub module.
q even positive coefficient disable : Writing a 1'b1 to this bit will disable auto calibration for the q even positive coefficient RX sampler latch calibration data sub module.
i even positive coefficient disable : Writing a 1'b1 to this bit will disable auto calibration for the i even positive coefficient RX sampler latch calibration data sub module.
e odd negative coefficient disable : Writing a 1'b1 to this bit will disable auto calibration for the e odd negative coefficient RX sampler latch calibration data sub module.
q odd negative coefficient disable : Writing a 1'b1 to this bit will disable auto calibration for the q odd negative coefficient RX sampler latch calibration data sub module.
i odd negative coefficient disable : Writing a 1'b1 to this bit will disable auto calibration for the i odd negative coefficient RX sampler latch calibration data sub module.
e odd positive coefficient disable : Writing a 1'b1 to this bit will disable auto calibration for the e odd positive coefficient RX sampler latch calibration data sub module.
q odd positive coefficient disable : Writing a 1'b1 to this bit will disable auto calibration for the q odd positive coefficient RX sampler latch calibration data sub module.
i odd positive coefficient disable : Writing a 1'b1 to this bit will disable auto calibration for the i odd positive coefficient RX sampler latch calibration data sub module.

register.description: CDRLF configuration register Offset = 8100h + (j * 400h); where j = 0h to 3h

bitfield.description: CDRLF second order loop integrator max clear enable: This signal enables the function in the CDRLF where the second order loop integrator is cleared when it reaches the maximum value.
CDRLF fast phase lock locked detected: This register bit is the current status of the fphl_locked pin on the CDRLF, and indicates the fast phase lock process is complete.
CDRLF fast phase lock diagnostic enable: This register bit can control the fphl_start pin on the CDRLF.
CDRLF fast phase lock enabled by signal detect: When active, signal detect will control the fphl_start pin on the CDRLF.

CDRLF reset on CDRLF PM Accumulator Max: Activating (1'b1) this bit will force the CDRLF to be reset when the PM accumulator in the CDRLF reaches is maximum absolute value (the largest positive or negative value).
CDRLF freeze on electrical idle detect: Activating (1'b1) this bit will force the CDRLF to be freeze in its current state when the receiver signal detect detects an electrical idle.
CDRLF reset on electrical idle detect: Activating (1'b1) this bit will force the CDRLF to be reset when the receiver signal detect detects an electrical idle.
CDRLF second order loop integrator threshold : This value is the maximum magnitude the CDRLF second order loop integrator will be allowed to go to.
CDLRF reset hold: When active (1'b1), the CDRLF will be held in reset beyond the time that it would normally be released by its asynchronous release signals.
CDRLF diagnostic mode control: This field controls the information driven on the rx_pi_val_ln_{15:0}[7:0] signal, when in diagnostics mode.
CDRLF second order loop disable: Activating (1'b1) this bit will disable the CDRLF second order loop.

CDRLF second order loop sigma delta update rate: This is the value that is added to or subtracted from the second order loop accumulator register when the serial data sample clock is detected as being out of phase with the serial data on a given parallel data word cycle.
CDRLF first order loop disable: Activating (1'b1) this bit will disable the CDRLF first order loop.

CDRLF first order loop sigma delta update rate: This is the value that is added to or subtracted from the first order loop accumulator register when the serial data sample clock is detected as being out of phase with the serial data on a given parallel data word cycle.

register.description: CDRLF configuration register 3 Offset = 8104h + (j * 400h); where j = 0h to 3h

bitfield.description: CDRLF PI override down : When the CDRLF PI override enable function is enabled, writing a 1'b1 to this bit will force a down to be generated in the CDRLF PI interface logic.
CDRLF PI override up : When the CDRLF PI override enable function is enabled, writing a 1'b1 to this bit will force an up to be generated in the CDRLF PI interface logic.

CDRLF PI override enable : Setting this bit to 1'b1 will enable the CDRLF PI override function, which will allow ups and downs to be forced to the CDRLF PI interface logic from the up and down override bits in this register.

CDRLF data filter enable standard mode 3 : Enables the filter function for the data that feeds into the CDRLF from the deserializer, using the rxda_cdrlf_data_filter_en_n signal, when xcvr_standard_mode is set to 2'b11.

CDRLF data filter enable standard mode 2 : Enables the filter function for the data that feeds into the CDRLF from the deserializer, using the rxda_cdrlf_data_filter_en_n signal, when xcvr_standard_mode is set to 2'b10.

CDRLF data filter enable standard mode 1 : Enables the filter function for the data that feeds into the CDRLF from the deserializer, using the rxda_cdrlf_data_filter_en_n signal, when xcvr_standard_mode is set to 2'b01.

CDRLF data filter enable standard mode 0 : Enables the filter function for the data that feeds into the CDRLF from the deserializer, using the rxda_cdrlf_data_filter_en_n signal, when xcvr_standard_mode is set to 2'b00.

register.description: CDRLF fast phase lock timer value register 0 Offset = 8108h + (j * 400h); where j = 0h to 3h

bitfield.description: Fast phase lock timer trigger 1 state time value : Specifies the number of clock cycles minus 1 that the fast phase lock state machine will remain in the trigger state the first time it is in that state.

Fast phase lock timer trigger 2 state time value : Specifies the number of clock cycles minus 1 that the fast phase lock state machine will remain in the trigger state the second time it is in that state.

Fast phase lock timer trigger 3 state time value : Specifies the number of clock cycles minus 1 that the fast phase lock state machine will remain in the trigger state the third time it is in that state.
Fast phase lock timer accumulate state time value : Specifies the number of clock cycles minus 1 that the fast phase lock state machine will remain in the accumulate state.
Fast phase lock timer delay state time value : Specifies the number of clock cycles minus 1 that the fast phase lock state machine will remain in the delay state.

register.description: Receiver signal detect filter high to low filter timer register Offset = 8120h + (j * 400h); where j = 0h to 3h

bitfield.description: Signal detect filter high to low delay timer value: This is the value loaded into the delay timer in the signal detect high to low filter circuit.
Signal detect filter high to low filter timer value: This is the value loaded into the filter timer in the signal detect high to low filter circuit.

register.description: Receiver signal detect filter high to low min timer register Offset = 8124h + (j * 400h); where j = 0h to 3h

bitfield.description: Signal detect init timer value: This is the value loaded into the initialization timer in the signal detect filter high to low filter circuit.
Signal detect filter high to low min timer value: This is the value loaded into the min timer in the signal detect high to low filter circuit.

register.description: Receiver signal detect filter low to high filter timer register Offset = 8128h + (j * 400h); where j = 0h to 3h

bitfield.description: Signal detect filter low to high min timer value: This is the value loaded into the min timer in the signal detect low to high filter circuit.

register.description: Receiver signal detect filter low to high min timer register Offset = 812Ch + (j * 400h); where j = 0h to 3h

bitfield.description: Signal detect init timer value: This is the value loaded into the initialization timer in the signal detect filter high to low filter circuit.
Signal detect filter high to low min timer value: This is the value loaded into the min timer in the signal detect high to low filter circuit.

register.description: Receiver LFPS detect minimum pulse distance counter register Offset = 8130h + (j * 400h); where j = 0h to 3h

bitfield.description: No signal counter value (NS): Specifies the number of clock cycles where pulse_high and pulse_low are inactive before declaring no signal.
Minimum pulse distance counter value (MD): Specifies the minimum pulse distance for a valid LFPS sequence.

register.description: Receiver LFPS detect ramp down counter register Offset = 8134h + (j * 400h); where j = 0h to 3h

bitfield.description: Minimum pulse duration (MP): Specifies the minimum number of clock cycles required for a given LFPS pulse to be driven active to be considered part of a valid LFPS burst.
Ramp down counter value (RD): Species the number of clock cycles that are used in the LFPS detect ramp down process.

register.description: Receiver LFPS detect diagnostic control register Offset = 8138h + (j * 400h); where j = 0h to 3h

bitfield.description: Disable pulse none MD check: When active (1'b1), the check that tests if pulse_none is driven inactive while the MD check is being performed will be disabled.
LFPS detect override enable: When active (1'b1), the LFPS detect override bit in this register will drive the LFPS detect output directly.
LFPS detect override: When enabled by the LFPS detect override enable bit in this register, this bit will drive the LFPS detect output directly.

register.description: Eye surf control register Offset = 8140h + (j * 400h); where j = 0h to 3h

bitfield.description: Eye surf run: Setting this bit to 1'b1 will initiate the eye surf process.
Eye surf done: When this bit is set to 1'b1, the eye surf process has completed.

register.description: Eye surf timer delay low register Offset = 8148h + (j * 400h); where j = 0h to 3h

bitfield.description: Most significant 16 bits of the delay time: The delay time specifies the number of clock cycles to wait between when a coordinate test point is set, and when to start testing the i and e data.
Least significant 16 bits of the delay time: The delay time specifies the number of clock cycles to wait between when a coordinate test point is set, and when to start testing the i and e data.

register.description: Eye surf timer test low register Offset = 814Ch + (j * 400h); where j = 0h to 3h

bitfield.description: Most significant 16 bits of the test time: The test time specifies the number of clock cycles to test the i and e data at a given coordinate test point.
Least significant 16 bits of the test time: The test time specifies the number of clock cycles to test the i and e data at a given coordinate test point.

register.description: Eye surf north south test point coordinate register Offset = 8150h + (j * 400h); where j = 0h to 3h

bitfield.description: Test point coordinate east west direction : Indicates whether the desired test point is in the
Test point coordinate east west offset : Indicates how many steps in the east or west
Test point coordinate north south direction : Indicates whether the desired test point is in the north or the south direction relative to the origin.
Test point coordinate north south offset : Indicates how many steps in the north or south direction the desired test point is relative to the origin.

register.description: Eye surf bit error count register Offset = 8154h + (j * 400h); where j = 0h to 3h

bitfield.description: Test point bit error count : The total number of bit errors that were detected for a given run of the eye surf function.

register.description: Receiver BIST control register Offset = 8160h + (j * 400h); where j = 0h to 3h

bitfield.description: Receiver BIST sync count: This field controls the value of the RX BIST sync count.
Receiver BIST mode: Controls which mode the BIST will operate in.
Receiver BIST error reset: Writing this bit is set to a 1'b1 will hold the error indicators in the receive BIST logic in reset.
Receiver BIST user defined data FIFO clear: Writing a 1'b1 to this bit will clear the receiver BIST user defined data FIFO.
Receiver BIST enable: This bit enables the receiver BIST function.

register.description: Receiver BIST user defined data write register Offset = 8164h + (j * 400h); where j = 0h to 3h

bitfield.description: Receiver BIST error count: Indicates the number of BIST errors that have been observed by the receive BIST logic, since the last time the BIST error indicator logic was reset or restarted.
Receiver BIST user defined data: Writing a data word to this field will result in that data word being placed in the next available position in the receiver BIST user defined data FIFO.

register.description: REE TX post cursor control register Offset = 8260h + (j * 400h); where j = 0h to 3h

bitfield.description: Peaking amp code maximum value: This is the maximum value that the peaking amp code will be allowed to increase to.
Peaking amp initial code: Initial value the peaking amp code is set to when training starts.
Peaking amp feedback path enable: Enables the peaking amp feedback path.
Peaking amp feedback scaler value: Specifies the amount to scale the peaking amp feedback by.
Peaking amp integrator accumulator scaler value: Specifies the amount to scale the input to the peaking amp integrator accumulator by.
Peaking amp sigma delta accumulator scaler value: Specifies the amount to scale the input to the peaking amp sigma delta accumulator by.

register.description: REE TX post cursor upper threshold register Offset = 8264h + (j * 400h); where j = 0h to 3h

bitfield.description: Peaking amp algorithm lower threshold: This is the lower threshold value used in the peaking amp algorithm.
Peaking amp algorithm upper threshold: This is the upper threshold value used in the peaking amp algorithm.

register.description: REE TX post cursor input override register Offset = 8268h + (j * 400h); where j = 0h to 3h

bitfield.description: Peaking amp code override value mode 1: Value that will override the peaking amp code when in standard mode 1 when the peaking amp code override enable bit in the REE TX post cursor diagnostics register on page 259 is active.

Peaking amp code override value mode 0: Value that will override the peaking amp code when in standard mode 0 when the peaking amp code override enable bit in the REE TX post cursor diagnostics register on page 259 is active.

Peaking amp tap accumulator input override enable: Setting this bit to a 1'b1 will allow the tap accumulator input in the peaking amp gain algorithm to be overridden by the peaking amp tap accumulator input override field in this register.

Peaking amp tap accumulator input override : Value that will override the tap accumulator input in the peaking amp gain algorithm, when the Peaking amp tap accumulator input override enable bit is active.

register.description: REE TX post cursor code override 1 register Offset = 826Ch + (j * 400h); where j = 0h to 3h

bitfield.description: Peaking amp code override enable: Setting this bit to a 1'b1 will allow the peaking amp code to be overridden by the peaking amp code override value fields in the REE TX post cursor code override 0 register on page 258 and REE TX post cursor code override 1 register on page 259.
Voter override neg : Writing a 1'b1 in this register bit will force the peaking amp voter function to activate the voter neg signal for a single clock cycle.
Voter override pos : Writing a 1'b1 in this register bit will force the peaking amp voter function to activate the voter pos signal for a single clock cycle.
Voter override enable : Setting this bit to a 1'b1 will allow only the voter override pos and voter override neg bits in this register to control the voter in the peaking amp.
Current peaking amp integrator accumulator: Current value of the tap integrator accumulator, without the unused sign bit.

Peaking amp code override value mode 3: Value that will override the peaking amp code when in standard mode 3 when the peaking amp code override enable bit in the REE TX post cursor diagnostics register on page 259 is active.

Peaking amp code override value mode 2: Value that will override the peaking amp code when in standard mode 2 when the peaking amp code override enable bit in the REE TX post cursor diagnostics register on page 259 is active.

register.description: REE TX pre cursor control register Offset = 8270h + (j * 400h); where j = 0h to 3h

bitfield.description: Tap override enable: Setting this bit to a 1'b1 will enable the tap override field in this register to override the tap integrator accumulator functions.

Tap override value: When the tap override enable bit in this register is active, the value in this field will override the integrator accumulator value, as well as the input to the binary to thermometer encoder.
Tap coefficient combinational logic zero crossing enable:
Tap coefficient combinational logic non zero crossing enable:
Tap coefficient combinational logic bit 0 only enable:
Receiver DFE tap coefficient disable: This bit disables the rxda_dfe_tap_coef output signal.
Tap integrator accumulator scaler value: Specifies the amount to scale the input to the tap integrator accumulator by.
Tap sigma delta accumulator scaler value: Specifies the amount to scale the input to the tap sigma delta accumulator by.

VGA gain override enable: Setting this bit to a 1'b1 will enable the VGA gain override field in this register to override the VGA gain integrator accumulator functions.

VGA gain override value: When the VGA gain override enable bit in this register is active, the value in this field will override the integrator accumulator value, as well as the input to the binary to thermometer encoder.
VGA gain max: Specifies the maximum value of the VGA gain integrator accumulator, and therefore also the maximum number of bits in the rxda_dfe_vga_gain thermometer code that will be set.
VGA gain integrator accumulator scaler value: Specifies the amount to scale the input to the VGA gain integrator accumulator by.
VGA gain sigma delta accumulator scaler value: Specifies the amount to scale the input to the VGA gain sigma delta accumulator by.

register.description: REE VGA gain diagnostics register Offset = 82C4h + (j * 400h); where j = 0h to 3h

bitfield.description: Current VGA gain integrator accumulator: Current value of the VGA gain integrator accumulator.
Voter override neg : Writing a 1'b1 in this register bit will force the VGA gain voter function to activate the voter neg signal for a single clock cycle.
Voter override pos : Writing a 1'b1 in this register bit will force the VGA gain voter function to activate the voter pos signal for a single clock cycle.
Voter override enable : Setting this bit to a 1'b1 will allow only the voter override pos and voter override neg bits in this register to control the voter in the VGA gain.
Current VGA gain integrator accumulator: Current value of the VGA gain integrator accumulator.

register.description: REE offset correction control register Offset = 82C8h + (j * 400h); where j = 0h to 3h

bitfield.description: Offset correction override enable: Setting this bit to a 1'b1 will enable the offset correction override field in this register to override the offset correction integrator accumulator functions.

Offset correction override value: When the offset correction override enable bit in this register is active, the value in this field will override the integrator accumulator value, as well as the input to the binary to thermometer encoder.
Offset correction integrator accumulator scaler value: Specifies the amount to scale the input to the offset correction integrator accumulator by.
Offset correction sigma delta accumulator scaler value: Specifies the amount to scale the input to the offset correction sigma delta accumulator by.

register.description: REE offset correction diagnostics register Offset = 82CCh + (j * 400h); where j = 0h to 3h

bitfield.description: Voter override neg : Writing a 1'b1 in this register bit will force the offset correction voter function to activate the voter neg signal for a single clock cycle.
Voter override pos : Writing a 1'b1 in this register bit will force the offset correction voter function to activate the voter pos signal for a single clock cycle.
Voter override enable : Setting this bit to a 1'b1 will allow only the voter override pos and voter override neg bits in this register to control the voter in the offset correction.
Current offset correction integrator accumulator: Current value of the offset correction integrator accumulator.

register.description: REE short channel correction valid word counter register Offset = 82D0h + (j * 400h); where j = 0h to 3h

bitfield.description: Threshold counter start value : Value used for the starting value when counting the number of bits that are below the error threshold.
Valid word counter start value : Value used for the starting value when counting the number of valid words.

register.description: REE adder configuration register Offset = 82E0h + (j * 400h); where j = 0h to 3h

bitfield.description: VGA target gain adjust multiplier: Controls how much to multiply the VGA target gain adjust by, when calculating the tap threshold.
Threshold adjust: Controls how much the threshold can be adjusted by, after multiplying the VGA target gain adjust multiplier with the VGA target gain adjust.
TX post cursor tap 3 adder enable: Setting this bit to 1'b1, enables the results of tap 3 to be added to the TX post cursor controller input.
TX post cursor tap 2 adder enable: Setting this bit to 1'b1, enables the results of tap 2 to be added to the TX post cursor controller input.
TX post cursor tap 1 adder enable: Setting this bit to 1'b1, enables the results of tap 1 to be added to the TX post cursor controller input.
RX peaking tap 3 adder enable: Setting this bit to 1'b1, enables the results of tap 3 to be added to the RX peaking amp gain input.
RX peaking tap 2 adder enable: Setting this bit to 1'b1, enables the results of tap 2 to be added to the RX peaking amp gain input.
RX peaking tap 1 adder enable: Setting this bit to 1'b1, enables the results of tap 1 to be added to the RX peaking amp gain input.

register.description: REE taps 2 and 3 clip control register Offset = 82E4h + (j * 400h); where j = 0h to 3h

bitfield.description: Ignore 1010 controller - Note that this is read only.

TX equalization evaluator: When set to 1'b0, this REE component will be turned off when control data is being received, when either the rx_eq_training_data_valid signal going inactive, or a 1010 pattern is detected on the data signals by the REE.

TX post cursor control: When set to 1'b0, this REE component will be turned off when control data is being received, when either the rx_eq_training_data_valid signal going inactive, or a 1010 pattern is detected on the data signals by the REE.

TX pre cursor control: When set to 1'b0, this REE component will be turned off when control data is being received, when either the rx_eq_training_data_valid signal going inactive, or a 1010 pattern is detected on the data signals by the REE.

Short channel correction: When set to 1'b0, this REE component will be turned off when control data is being received, when either the rx_eq_training_data_valid signal going inactive, or a 1010 pattern is detected on the data signals by the REE.

RX attenuation: When set to 1'b0, this REE component will be turned off when control data is being received, when either the rx_eq_training_data_valid signal going inactive, or a 1010 pattern is detected on the data signals by the REE.

RX VGA gain: When set to 1'b0, this REE component will be turned off when control data is being received, when either the rx_eq_training_data_valid signal going inactive, or a 1010 pattern is detected on the data signals by the REE.

RX offset correction coefficient: When set to 1'b0, this REE component will be turned off when control data is being received, when either the rx_eq_training_data_valid signal going inactive, or a 1010 pattern is detected on the data signals by the REE.

RX peaking amp gain: When set to 1'b0, this REE component will be turned off when control data is being received, when either the rx_eq_training_data_valid signal going inactive, or a 1010 pattern is detected on the data signals by the REE.

RX low frequency equalizer adaptive control: When set to 1'b0, this REE component will be turned off when control data is being received, when either the rx_eq_training_data_valid signal going inactive, or a 1010 pattern is detected on the data signals by the REE.

RX tap 3: When set to 1'b0, this REE component will be turned off when control data is being received, when either the rx_eq_training_data_valid signal going inactive, or a 1010 pattern is detected on the data signals by the REE.

RX tap 2: When set to 1'b0, this REE component will be turned off when control data is being received, when either the rx_eq_training_data_valid signal going inactive, or a 1010 pattern is detected on the data signals by the REE.

RX tap 1: When set to 1'b0, this REE component will be turned off when control data is being received, when either the rx_eq_training_data_valid signal going inactive, or a 1010 pattern is detected on the data signals by the REE.
VGA target gain adjust multiplier: Controls how much to multiply the VGA target gain adjust by, when calculating the tap threshold.
Threshold adjust: Controls how much the threshold can be adjusted by, after multiplying the VGA target gain adjust multiplier with the VGA target gain adjust.

register.description: REE coefficient FIFO diagnostic register Offset = 82E8h + (j * 400h); where j = 0h to 3h

bitfield.description: Analog tap disable: When this bit is set to 1'b1, the rxda_dfe_tap_1_coef, rxda_dfe_tap_2_coef, and rxda_dfe_tap_3_coef signals being driven to the analog will be forced to all 0s.

Hold periodic equalization while RX idle: When this bit is set to 1'b1, a detection of electrical idle on the receiver (rx_signal_detect is set to 1'b0), will disable the periodic REE general control state machine, and as a result freeze the current state of the parts of the REE that are controlled by it.

Hold general control state machine 2 equalization while RX idle: When this bit is set to 1'b1, a detection of electrical idle on the receiver (rx_signal_detect is set to 1'b0), will disable the REE general control state machine 2, and as a result freeze the current state of the parts of the REE that are controlled by it.

Hold general control state machine 1 equalization while RX idle: When this bit is set to 1'b1, a detection of electrical idle on the receiver (rx_signal_detect is set to 1'b0), will disable the REE general control state machine 1, and as a result freeze the current state of the parts of the REE that are controlled by it.
Enable REE control clock on : Enables the REE control clock.
Force REE function clock on : When active, the REE function clock gate will allow the clock to run.
FIFO underflow : Indicates when a FIFO underflow condition has occurred.
FIFO empty :Indicates that the FIFO is empty.
FIFO output dequeue : Writing a 1'b1 to this bit will dequeue the current values from the output of the FIFO.
FIFO output override enable : Enables the FIFO output override functions.
FIFO output data pre cursor increment : Current value on the pre cursor increment bit on the FIFO output.
FIFO output data pre cursor decrement : Current value on the pre cursor decrement bit on the FIFO output.
FIFO output data post cursor increment : Current value on the post cursor increment bit on the FIFO output.
FIFO output data post cursor decrement : Current value on the post cursor decrement bit on the FIFO output.
FIFO overflow :Indicates when a FIFO overflow condition has occurred.
FIFO full :Indicates that the FIFO is full.
FIFO input enqueue : Writing a 1'b1 to this bit will enqueue the values of the FIFO input data bits in this register to their respective FIFO bits.
FIFO input override enable : Enables the FIFO input override functions.
FIFO input data pre cursor increment : Pre cursor increment value that will be enqueued to the FIFO by the FIFO input enqueue bit in this register.
FIFO input data pre cursor decrement : Pre cursor decrement value that will be enqueued to the FIFO by the FIFO input enqueue bit in this register.
FIFO input data post cursor increment : Post cursor increment value that will be enqueued to the FIFO by the FIFO input enqueue bit in this register.
FIFO input data post cursor decrement : Post cursor decrement value that will be enqueued to the FIFO by the FIFO input enqueue bit in this register.

register.description: REE TX equalization evaluator control register Offset = 82ECh + (j * 400h); where j = 0h to 3h

bitfield.description: REE Periodic general control state machine enable standard mode 3: This bit will control if the REE periodic general control state machine will run, when xcvr_standard_mode is set to 2'b11.
REE Periodic general control state machine enable standard mode 2: This bit will control if the REE periodic general control state machine will run, when xcvr_standard_mode is set to 2'b10.
REE Periodic general control state machine enable standard mode 1: This bit will control if the REE periodic general control state machine will run, when xcvr_standard_mode is set to 2'b01.
REE Periodic general control state machine enable standard mode 0: This bit will control if the REE periodic general control state machine will run, when xcvr_standard_mode is set to 2'b00.

REE general control state machine 2 enable standard mode 0: This bit will control if the REE general control state machine 2 will run, when xcvr_standard_mode is set to 2'b00.
REE general control state machine 1 enable standard mode 3: This bit will control if the REE general control state machine 1 will run, when xcvr_standard_mode is set to 2'b11.

TX main coefficient direction change control: This bit controls the function of the main coefficient direction change.

TX equalization evaluator pre-emphasis decrement count: Contains a count of the total number of pre-emphasis decrement responses that have taken place during the TX equalization evaluator process.

REE PCIe Gen 3 TX equalization state machine E path en standard mode 2: This bit controls if the REE PCIE Gen 3 TX equalization state machine will enable the analog E path when xcvr_standard_mode is set to 2'b10.

REE PCIe Gen 3 TX equalization state machine E path en standard mode 1: This bit controls if the REE PCIE Gen 3 TX equalization state machine will enable the analog E path when xcvr_standard_mode is set to 2'b01.

REE PCIe Gen 3 TX equalization state machine E path en standard mode 0: This bit controls if the REE PCIE Gen 3 TX equalization state machine will enable the analog E path when xcvr_standard_mode is set to 2'b00.

REE Periodic general control state machine E path en standard mode 3: This bit controls if the REE periodic general control state machine will enable the analog E path when xcvr_standard_mode is set to 2'b11.

REE general control state machine 2 E path en standard mode 3: This bit controls if the REE general control state machine 2 will enable the analog E path when xcvr_standard_mode is set to 2'b11.
REE general control state machine 2 E path en standard mode 2: This bit controls if the REE general control state machine 2 will enable the analog E path when xcvr_standard_mode is set to 2'b10.
REE general control state machine 2 E path en standard mode 1: This bit controls if the REE general control state machine 2 will enable the analog E path when xcvr_standard_mode is set to 2'b01.
REE general control state machine 2 E path en standard mode 0: This bit controls if the REE general control state machine 2 will enable the analog E path when xcvr_standard_mode is set to 2'b00.
REE general control state machine 1 E path en standard mode 3: This bit controls if the REE general control state machine 1 will enable the analog E path when xcvr_standard_mode is set to 2'b11.
REE general control state machine 1 E path en standard mode 2: This bit controls if the REE general control state machine 1 will enable the analog E path when xcvr_standard_mode is set to 2'b10.
REE general control state machine 1 E path en standard mode 1: This bit controls if the REE general control state machine 1 will enable the analog E path when xcvr_standard_mode is set to 2'b01.

register.description: REE TX equalization evaluator post-emphasis register Offset = 82F4h + (j * 400h); where j = 0h to 3h

bitfield.description: TX equalization evaluator post-emphasis increment count: Contains a count of the total number of post-emphasis increment responses that have taken place during the TX equalization evaluator process.
TX equalization evaluator post-emphasis decrement count: Contains a count of the total number of post-emphasis decrement responses that have taken place during the TX equalization evaluator process.

register.description: Clock frequency measurement control register Offset = 8380h + (j * 400h); where j = 0h to 3h

bitfield.description: Test clock select: This field drives the test_clk_select pin, in order to control an external MUX for selecting between multiple test clocks to measure.
Run test clock measurement: Activating (1'b1) this bit will run the test clock measurement process.
Test clock measurement done: This bit will be set to 1'b1 when the test clock measurement process is complete.

register.description: Reference clock timer value register Offset = 8384h + (j * 400h); where j = 0h to 3h

bitfield.description: Test clock counter value: When the test clock measurement process is complete, the value in this field specifies the number of test clock cycles that were counted in the time specified by the reference clock timer value.
Reference clock timer value : This specifies the amount of time, in reference clock cycles, to count test clock cycles.

register.description: Receiver DFE control register Offset = 83C0h + (j * 400h); where j = 0h to 3h

bitfield.description: DFE constant gm bias tune: Adjusts the constant gm bias.
DFE VGA constant gm bias enable: Enables the VGA constant gm bias.
DFE VGA amp current adjust: Adjusts the current for the DFE VGA amp, using the rxda_vga_current_adj signal, as specified below.
DFE peaking constant gm bias enable: Enables the peaking constant gm bias.
DFE peaking amp current adjust: Adjusts the current for the DFE peaking amp, using the rxda_peak_current_adj signal, as specified below.
DFE summing constant gm bias enable: Enables the summing constant gm bias.
DFE summing amp current adjust: Adjusts the current for the DFE summing amp, using the rxda_sum_current_adj signal, as specified below.

Receiver DFE low frequency equalization enable value standard mode 3: This bit controls the rxda_dfe_lfeq_en signal going to the analog, which is used to enable the receiver DFE low frequency equalization analog circuits, when xcvr_standard_mode is set to 2'b11.

Receiver DFE low frequency equalization enable value standard mode 2: This bit controls the rxda_dfe_lfeq_en signal going to the analog, which is used to enable the receiver DFE low frequency equalization analog circuits, when xcvr_standard_mode is set to 2'b10.

Receiver DFE low frequency equalization enable value standard mode 1: This bit controls the rxda_dfe_lfeq_en signal going to the analog, which is used to enable the receiver DFE low frequency equalization analog circuits, when xcvr_standard_mode is set to 2'b01.

Receiver DFE low frequency equalization enable value standard mode 0: This bit controls the rxda_dfe_lfeq_en signal going to the analog, which is used to enable the receiver DFE low frequency equalization analog circuits, when xcvr_standard_mode is set to 2'b00.

register.description: DFE amp fine tuning 2 register Offset = 83C4h + (j * 400h); where j = 0h to 3h

bitfield.description: DFE VGA stage 1 boost standard mode 3: This bit enables the active inductors boost function in stage 1 of the VGA, for high data rates, when xcvr_standard_mode is set to 2'b11.
DFE VGA stage 1 boost standard mode 2: This bit enables the active inductors boost function in stage 1 of the VGA, for high data rates, when xcvr_standard_mode is set to 2'b10.
DFE VGA stage 1 boost standard mode 1: This bit enables the active inductors boost function in stage 1 of the VGA, for high data rates, when xcvr_standard_mode is set to 2'b01.
DFE VGA stage 1 boost standard mode 0: This bit enables the active inductors boost function in stage 1 of the VGA, for high data rates, when xcvr_standard_mode is set to 2'b00.
Receiver peaking amp common mode adjust: Adjusts the common mode voltage for the receiver peaking amp, by driving the rxda_fe_pkamp_cm_adj signal to the analog.
DFE low frequency equalizer constant gm bias enable: Enables the low frequency equalizer constant gm bias.
DFE low frequency equalizer current adjust: Adjusts the current for the DFE low frequency equalizer, using the rxda_lfeq_current_adj signal, as specified below.
DFE peaking amp boost: Enables the active inductors boost function in the peaking amp, for high data rates.
Reserved - Spare
DFE VGA stage 2 boost: Enables the active inductors boost function in stage 2 of the VGA, for high data rates.
DFE RX Tap 1 DAC Range Select: Controls the tap 1 DAC range in the analog DFE.
DFE RX amp current adjust: Adjusts the mix of constant-gm and External Current for RX front end amplifiers.

register.description: REE DAC control register Offset = 83C8h + (j * 400h); where j = 0h to 3h

bitfield.description: RX nyquist select value standard mode 3: This field specifies the receiver DFE nyquist frequency select value on the rxda_dfe_nqst_sel signal driven to the analog, when xcvr_standard_mode is set to 2'b11.

RX nyquist select value standard mode 2: This field specifies the receiver DFE nyquist frequency select value on the rxda_dfe_nqst_sel signal driven to the analog, when xcvr_standard_mode is set to 2'b10.

RX nyquist select value standard mode 1: This field specifies the receiver DFE nyquist frequency select value on the rxda_dfe_nqst_sel signal driven to the analog, when xcvr_standard_mode is set to 2'b01.

RX nyquist select value standard mode 0: This field specifies the receiver DFE nyquist frequency select value on the rxda_dfe_nqst_sel signal driven to the analog, when xcvr_standard_mode is set to 2'b00.
DFE Offset DAC enable: Enables the DFE offset DAC associated with the VGA amp.
DFE Offset DAC attenuation: Adds attenuation to the DFE offset DAC associated with the VGA amp.
DFE DAC attenuation: Adds attenuation to the DFE DACs associated with the summing amp.

register.description: Low frequency equalizer tuning register Offset = 83CCh + (j * 400h); where j = 0h to 3h

bitfield.description: RX low frequency equalization zero frequency value standard mode 3: This field specifies the receiver zero frequency setting for the low frequency equalization function, by driving the rxda_dfe_lfeq_zero_freq signal going into the analog, when xcvr_standard_mode is set to 2'b11.

RX low frequency equalization zero frequency value standard mode 2: This field specifies the receiver zero frequency setting for the low frequency equalization function, by driving the rxda_dfe_lfeq_zero_freq signal going into the analog, when xcvr_standard_mode is set to 2'b10.

RX low frequency equalization zero frequency value standard mode 1: This field specifies the receiver zero frequency setting for the low frequency equalization function, by driving the rxda_dfe_lfeq_zero_freq signal going into the analog, when xcvr_standard_mode is set to 2'b01.

RX low frequency equalization zero frequency value standard mode 0: This field specifies the receiver zero frequency setting for the low frequency equalization function, by driving the rxda_dfe_lfeq_zero_freq signal going into the analog, when xcvr_standard_mode is set to 2'b00.

register.description: RX signal detect tuning and control register Offset = 83D0h + (j * 400h); where j = 0h to 3h

bitfield.description: Signal detect 1 up: Signal detect 1 calibration up signal value, as it is currently captured in the sample and hold latches.
Signal detect 1 code: Signal detect 1 calibration code signal value, as it is currently captured in the sample and hold latches.
Signal detect 0 up: Signal detect 0 calibration up signal value, as it is currently captured in the sample and hold latches.
Signal detect 0 code: Signal detect 0 calibration code signal value, as it is currently captured in the sample and hold latches.

Signal detect calibration half gain select: Controls the resolution of each step in the signal detect calibration code by adjusting the gain of signal detect offset correction, by driving the rxda_sd_cal_halfgain signal going to the analog, as specified below.
Signal detect filter function select: Selects which of the two RX signal detect filter functions are enabled.
Receiver signal detect invert samplers: Inverts the behavior of the rxda_sd_pulse_high and rxda_sd_pulse_low samplers, by driving the rxda_sd_invert_samplers signal to the analog.
Receiver signal detect squelch pulse none: Enable the squelch function for the rxda_sd_pulse_none signal, by driving the rxda_sd_squelch_pulse_none signal to the analog.
Receiver signal detect one comparator mode: Enables one comparator mode, as a power reduction option, by driving the rxda_sd_onecomp_mode_en signal to the analog.
Receiver signal detect DC coupled path enable: Enables a DC coupled path to the signal detect for verification and testability purposes, by driving the rxda_sd_dcpath_en signal to the analog.
Signal detect level: Sets the reference voltage level at which the comparators will detect a signal by driving the rxda_sd_siglvl_n signal going to the analog.

register.description: Signal detect test register Offset = 83D4h + (j * 400h); where j = 0h to 3h

bitfield.description: LFPS detected low test bit: This bit can be used to detect if the rx_lfps_detect is driven to a low state.
LFPS detected high test bit: This bit can be used to detect if the rx_lfps_detect is driven to a high state.
Signal detected low test bit: This bit can be used to detect if the rx_signal_detect is driven to a low state.
Signal detected high test bit: This bit can be used to detect if the rx_signal_detect is driven to a high state.

bitfield.description: RX sampler latch calibration E even negative code: RX sampler latch calibration E even negative code signal value, as it is currently captured in the sample and hold latches.

register.description: PI rate selection register Offset = 83E8h + (j * 400h); where j = 0h to 3h

bitfield.description: PI capacitor selection standard mode 3: This field is used to implement waveform shaping inside the PI CML cells, by changing the capacitive loading.
PI capacitor selection standard mode 2: This field is used to implement waveform shaping inside the PI CML cells, by changing the capacitive loading.
PI capacitor selection standard mode 1: This field is used to implement waveform shaping inside the PI CML cells, by changing the capacitive loading.
PI capacitor selection standard mode 0: This field is used to implement waveform shaping inside the PI CML cells, by changing the capacitive loading.

PI rate selection standard mode 3: This field is used to scale the power of the CML cells inside the PI to tune it for a given data rate, by driving the rxda_pi_rate_sel signal going into the analog, when xcvr_standard_mode is set to 2'b11.

PI rate selection standard mode 2: This field is used to scale the power of the CML cells inside the PI to tune it for a given data rate, by driving the rxda_pi_rate_sel signal going into the analog, when xcvr_standard_mode is set to 2'b10.

PI rate selection standard mode 1: This field is used to scale the power of the CML cells inside the PI to tune it for a given data rate, by driving the rxda_pi_rate_sel signal going into the analog, when xcvr_standard_mode is set to 2'b01.

PI rate selection standard mode 0: This field is used to scale the power of the CML cells inside the PI to tune it for a given data rate, by driving the rxda_pi_rate_sel signal going into the analog, when xcvr_standard_mode is set to 2'b00.

register.description: PI tuning register Offset = 83ECh + (j * 400h); where j = 0h to 3h

Receiver CML to CMOS rate select value standard mode 2: This bit will drive the rxda_c2c_rate_sel signal going into the analog, when xcvr_standard_mode is set to 2'b10.
Receiver CML to CMOS rate select value standard mode 1: This bit will drive the rxda_c2c_rate_sel signal going into the analog, when xcvr_standard_mode is set to 2'b01.
Receiver CML to CMOS rate select value standard mode 0: This bit will drive the rxda_c2c_rate_sel signal going into the analog, when xcvr_standard_mode is set to 2'b00.
PI current select: Selects either the external based bias or the poly based bias for the PI, by driving the rxda_pi_cur_sel signal going into the analog.

Current state of the rx_lfps_det_filter_reset_n reset.
Recovered clock loopback select: Selects which recovered clock to use when recovered clock loopback is enabled.
Attenuation settings: Sets the attenuation for the ISI generation loopback filter, as specified below.

bitfield.description: Reserved - spare
Reserved - spare

register.description: PIPE common control1 register

bitfield.description: USB SuperSpeed Tx LFPS Stretch : Minimum number of data rate clock cycles in which PMA tx_lfps_en signal is asserted for USB SuperSpeed rate.
USB SuperSpeedPlus Tx LFPS Stretch : Minimum number of data rate clock cycles in which PMA tx_lfps_en signal is asserted for USB SuperSpeedPlus rate.
PCIe PCS TX electrical idle pre release:When this bit is set, the TX electrical idle release to the PMA is advanced 1
RX equaliser complete mask: When this bit is cleared, the PHY will return direction change of 0 when PMA indicates evaluation complete.
PCIe PCS EIOS cycle error mask: When this bit is enabled and the pipe rx interface is outputting an EIOS symbol, decode errors will be masked out
USB Gen 2 Bit Error Correction Disable: When this bit is high, bit error correction on SKP and SDS symbols is disabled.
USB PIPE3 Compatibility Mode enable : When this bit is set to 1, USB PIPE3 compatibility mode is enabled.
USB Loopback Slave Error Count disable: When this bit is set to 1, disables the error count for US loopback slave, such that the error count is not inserted into the BCNT OS.

USB Elasticity Buffer Re-align enable: When this bit is set to 1, when Rx for a USB link is initially started, the elasticity buffer is re-aligned to its idle point upon seeing 3 consecutive COMMAs (i.e.
PHY APB access timeout: When set, an APB read/write request to PHY registers failed (i.e. timed out).
PCIe PCS Comma realign: This field controls the comma alignment state machine to re-align to new bit position without going to loss of sync state.
Block alignment clear on EIOS : When set, upon receiving a PCIe EIOS, 128b/130b block alignment is reset regardless of Rx signal detect from the PMA (applies for PCIe Gen 3 only).
Comma alignment clear on EIOS : When set, upon receiving a PCIe EIOS, Comma Alignment is reset regardless of Rx signal detect from the PMA (applies for PCIe Gen 1/2 only).
Block alignment ignore Rx SigDetect : When set, 128b/13xb block alignment will not be reset due to loss of signal detection from the PMA (applies for PCIe Gen 3 and USB3.1 Gen 2 only).
Comma alignment ignore Rx SigDetect : When set, Comma alignment will not be reset due to loss of signal detection from the PMA (applies for PCIe Gen 1/2 and USB3.1 Gen 1 only).
Rx signal detect delay : Selects the number of clock cycles of delay to add to the PMA signal detect when the bit alignment blocks should be reset after losing signal.
RefClk disable override:
PHY RefClk enable input ingnore :

register.description: PIPE comma lock configuration1 register

bitfield.description: PCIe PCS Comma lock count fast: The number of COMMA symbols that needs to be seen in the same bit position for the comma state machine to lock.
PCIe PCS Comma lock count: The number of COMMA symbols that needs to be seen in the same bit position for the comma state machine to lock.
PCIe PCS Comma unlock count: The number of COMMA symbols that need to be seen in the wrong bit position before the comma alignment state machine will transition to RESYNC or LOS state
PCIe PCS Comma full lock count: The number of COMMA symbols that need to be seen in the same bit position for the comma alignment state machine to lock.

register.description: PIPE EIEOS lock configuration register

bitfield.description: PIPE lane disable: Each bit corresponds to a lane (i.e. bit [0] -X lane 0, bit [1] -X lane 1, etc).
EIE lock count fast: The number of EIEOS blocks that need to be seen in the same bit postion for the alignment state machine to lock for Gen3/4.
EIE lock count : The number of EIEOS blocks that need to be seen in the same bit postion for the alignment state machine to lock for Gen3/4.
EIE full lock count: The number of EIEOS blocks that need to be seen in the same bit postion for the alignment state machine to lock for Gen3/4.

PCS Receiver Detect Inhibit Counter Load Value: Counter load value to delay receiver detection request to PMA until PMA common mode is within the required range.
